original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, do Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas, abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: perfect the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines,

original: le'u lnga bcu gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu gnyis pa'o ////
translated: Chapter Fifty-Two.

original: @136a *// de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: @136a *// de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: addressed the Blessed One as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de yun ring po ji srid cig nas yang dag par zhugs pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de yun ring po ji srid cig nas yang dag par zhugs pa lags /
translated: for how long have those Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas who possess such skillful means set out on the right path?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig grangs med pa nas yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig grangs med pa nas yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti : A Bodhisattva who is endowed with such skill in means, has he set out for long for full enlightenment?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord : He has set out for long, for countless aeons.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa des sangs rgyas ji snyed cig bsnyen bkur ba lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni /🔽sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed bsnyen bkur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa des sangs rgyas ji snyed cig bsnyen bkur ba lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni / sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed bsnyen bkur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti : How many Buddhas has he worshipped?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord : As many as there are sands in the river Ganges.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa des dge ba'i rtsa ba ci zhig bskyed pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa des dge ba'i rtsa ba ci zhig bskyed pa lags /
translated: Subhuti : What roots of good has he planted?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “From the time of first generating the mind of enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan @136b pa des yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan @136b pa des yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do /
translated: there is no act of the perfection of generosity that is not completed by that bodhisattva great being who possesses such skillful means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang /
translated: There is no act of the perfection of morality that is not completed by that bodhisattva great being, no act of the perfection of patience, no act of the perfection of effort,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bya ba de lta bu gang yang med do //
translated: no act of the perfection of concentration, and no act of the perfection of wisdom that is not completed by that bodhisattva great being.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who have such skillful means are amazing.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who have such skillful means are amazing.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhir las byed cing gling bzhi'i rjes su 'gro'o //
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhir las byed cing gling bzhi'i rjes su 'gro'o //
translated: the sun’s disk and the moon’s disk do the work of the four continents and follow the four continents.

original: gling bzhi'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: gling bzhi'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: They follow the four continents.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i las byed cing pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'gro /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i las byed cing pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'gro /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the perfection of wisdom does the work of the five perfections and follows the five perfections.

original: rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: It follows the five perfections.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na /
translated: When it is not separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob bo //
translated: The five perfections get the name of perfections because of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
translated: If they were separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga @137a *//
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga @137a *//
translated: the five perfections

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i ming mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i ming mi 'thob bo //
translated: would not get the name of perfections.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as,

original: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang bral na /
analyzed: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang bral na /
translated: if separated from a universal monarch,

original: rin po che sna bdun gyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i ming mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i ming mi 'thob bo //
translated: the seven precious things of the universal monarch do not get the name of precious things.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
translated: Subhūti, just so, if the five perfections are separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob po //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob po //
translated: they do not get the name of perfections.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as,

original: dper na / khyim thab med pa'i bud med rnams ni 'phyon ma pa rnams kyis tshugs par sla ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na / khyim thab med pa'i bud med rnams ni 'phyon ma pa rnams kyis tshugs par sla ba yin no //
translated: for example, women without husbands are easily seduced by pimps.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
translated: Subhūti, just so, if the five perfections are separated from the perfection of wisdom,🔽they are easily seduced by the demon and the demon’s minions.

original: bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis tshugs par slab yin no //
analyzed: bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis tshugs par slab yin no //
translated: It is easy for Māra or the gods of Māra’s class to overpower them.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / khyim thab dpa' bos shin tu bsrungs pa'i bud med shin tu phun sum tshogs pa'i khyim na 'dug pa ni 'phyon ma pa rnams kyis mi tshugs pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na / khyim thab dpa' bos shin tu bsrungs pa'i bud med shin tu phun sum tshogs pa'i khyim na 'dug pa ni 'phyon ma pa rnams kyis mi tshugs pa yin no //
translated: a woman who is well protected by a heroic husband, living in a very prosperous house, is not overpowered by prostitutes.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, when the five perfections are not separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis mi tshugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis mi tshugs pa yin no //
translated: they are not overpowered by Māra or the gods of Māra’s class.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / g-yul du 'gro ba'i skyes bu go cha tshang bar gyon pa /
analyzed: dper na / g-yul du 'gro ba'i skyes bu go cha tshang bar gyon pa /
translated: a person going into battle, wearing complete armor,

original: mtshon cha thams cad thogs pa ni g-yul ngo na 'dug pa'i tshe /🔽rgyal po'i zla'am /
analyzed: mtshon cha thams cad thogs pa ni g-yul ngo na 'dug pa'i tshe / rgyal po'i zla'am /
translated: holding all weapons, when standing in battle,🔽is difficult for the king’s men,

original: phyir rgol ba dang / dgra rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba dang / dgra rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
translated: or opponents and enemies, to overpower.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes @137b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na /🔽bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams dang / gang zag lhag pa'i nga rgyal can nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes @137b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral na / bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams dang / gang zag lhag pa'i nga rgyal can nam /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the five perfections, when not separated from the perfection of wisdom,🔽are difficult to defeat even by Māra or the gods of Māra’s realm, or by proud individuals,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gdol pa rnams kyis kyang thub par dka'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gdol pa rnams kyis kyang thub par dka'o /
translated: or by outcast bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la khams kyi rgyal po yod pa rnams ni nang nub /
analyzed: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la khams kyi rgyal po yod pa rnams ni nang nub /
translated: for example, the minor kings who are vassals of a wheel-turning king come to his presence

original: nang nub cing rim gro bya ba'i don du drung du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: nang nub cing rim gro bya ba'i don du drung du 'ong ngo //
translated: in the morning and evening to pay their respects.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the five perfections, when embraced by the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong ngo //
translated: go to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / chu klung gang ji snyed cig yod pa thams cad ni chu klung chen po gangg'a gang na ba der 'dong ste /
analyzed: dper na / chu klung gang ji snyed cig yod pa thams cad ni chu klung chen po gangg'a gang na ba der 'dong ste /
translated: For example, whatever rivers there are, all of them go to the great river Ganges,

original: de dag chu klung gangg'a dang 'grogs shing rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du 'dong ngo //
analyzed: de dag chu klung gangg'a dang 'grogs shing rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du 'dong ngo //
translated: and they go to the great ocean together with the Ganges river.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, when the five perfections are assisted by the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong ngo //
translated: they go to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu'i lag pa g-yas pa ni dgos pa thams cad byed do //
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu'i lag pa g-yas pa ni dgos pa thams cad byed do //
translated: for example, a person’s right hand does all the work.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de bzhin du blta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de bzhin du blta ste /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom should be regarded in the same way,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni lag pa g-yon pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni lag pa g-yon pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta'o //
translated: and the five perfections should be regarded as like the left hand.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / chu klung phra mo rnams kyi chu dang / chu klung chen po rnams kyi chu gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang rgya mtsho chen por phyin na /
analyzed: dper na / chu klung phra mo rnams kyi chu dang / chu klung chen po rnams kyi chu gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang rgya mtsho chen por phyin na /
translated: For example, whatever water there is in the small streams and the great rivers,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: all that

original: lan tshva'i ror ro gcig par @138a *//
analyzed: lan tshva'i ror ro gcig par @138a *//
translated: has the same single taste, that is, the taste of salt,

original: 'gyur ro // rab 'byor /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // rab 'byor /
translated: when it reaches the great ocean.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, when the five perfections, taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du phyin pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du phyin pa'i tshe /
translated: reach the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'di lta ste /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ror ro gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ror ro gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: they

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mdun du ni 'khor lo rin po che 'gro zhing 'dug ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mdun du ni 'khor lo rin po che 'gro zhing 'dug ste /
translated: have the same single taste, that is, the taste of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gang du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po zas kyi don du 'dug par gyur pa der /
analyzed: gang du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po zas kyi don du 'dug par gyur pa der /
translated: For example, Subhūti, the precious wheel of a wheel-turning emperor goes in front of the four-part army, and it stops where the wheel-turning emperor stops for the sake of food.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs thams cad yongs su tshim par byed cing /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs thams cad yongs su tshim par byed cing /
translated: The precious wheel of the universal monarch satisfies the entire army,

original: 'khor lo rin po che de gnas nas g-yo ba med do //
analyzed: 'khor lo rin po che de gnas nas g-yo ba med do //
translated: and that precious wheel does not move from its place.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bkri ba yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bkri ba yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, these five perfections are led by the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong zhing der gnas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong zhing der gnas so //
translated: and they go where the knowledge of all aspects is, and they stay there.

original: der gnas par gyur nas kyang gnas de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: der gnas par gyur nas kyang gnas de las mi 'da'o //
translated: Having stayed there, they do not pass beyond that place.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che de dang / blon po rin po che de dang / khyim bdag rin po che de dang / bud med rin po che de dang / nor bu rin po che de dang /
analyzed: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che de dang / blon po rin po che de dang / khyim bdag rin po che de dang / bud med rin po che de dang / nor bu rin po che de dang /
translated: the precious wheel of the universal monarch, the precious minister, the precious queen, the precious jewel, the precious elephant, the precious horse, and the precious steward—

original: glang po rin po che de dang / rta rin po che de dag ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'dong ngo /
analyzed: glang po rin po che de dang / rta rin po che de dag ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'dong ngo /
translated: Those precious elephants and those precious horses go in front of the four divisions of the army.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @138b pa'ang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi mdun du 'gro ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @138b pa'ang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi mdun du 'gro ste /
translated: Similarly, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom goes in front of these five perfections,

original: mdun du song nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdun du song nas kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: and having gone in front it stands where the knowledge of all aspects is.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di snyam du bdag gi phyi bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di snyam du bdag gi phyi bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not think, ‘The perfection of giving follows after me.’

original: 'di snyam du bdag gi phyi bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gi phyi bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: It does not think, ‘The perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, or perfection of concentration follows after me.’

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The perfection of generosity does not think, “I follow the perfection of wisdom.”

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol phyin pa'ang 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol phyin pa'ang 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: The perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of meditation do not think, “I follow the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ni 'di yin te /
translated: Because this is their nature.

original: ci'ang nus pa med pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing gsog ste /
analyzed: ci'ang nus pa med pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing gsog ste /
translated: They are completely incapable, empty of inherent nature, and hollow.

original: smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: They are like a mirage.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are empty of inherent nature,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi @139a *//
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi @139a *//
translated: How do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes kyi pha rol phyin pa la spyod pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes kyi pha rol phyin pa la spyod pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the six perfections,

original: 'di snyam du kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
translated: they think, ‘Alas! The world is lost, for beings in the world have minds that have gone wrong.

original: de dag ni thabs la mi mkhas pas 'khor ba nas yongs su gdon par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni thabs la mi mkhas pas 'khor ba nas yongs su gdon par mi nus kyi /
translated: They are not skilled in means and so are unable to free themselves from saṃsāra.

original: ma la bdag gis sems can de dag gi don du sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ma la bdag gis sems can de dag gi don du sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: “I must practice the perfection of generosity for the sake of those beings.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: I must practice the perfection of moral discipline.🔽I must practice the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: I must practice the perfection of perseverance.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: I must practice the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I must practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de sems can de dag gi don du phyi nang gi dngos po rnams yongs su gtong ste /🔽de yongs su gtong ba'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de sems can de dag gi don du phyi nang gi dngos po rnams yongs su gtong ste / de yongs su gtong ba'i tshe 'di snyam ste /
translated: ’ “For the sake of those beings, they give up outer and inner things.

original: bdag gis gang yang yongs su ma btang ba med do //
analyzed: bdag gis gang yang yongs su ma btang ba med do //
translated: When they give them up, they think, ‘There is nothing that I have not given up.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar dngos po 'di dag ni bdag nyid 'jig pa'o snyam ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po 'di dag ni bdag nyid 'jig pa'o snyam ste /
translated: Because these things are themselves perishable.’

original: rab @139b 'byor /
analyzed: rab @139b 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who investigates in that way perfects the perfection of generosity.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du tshul khrims ngan pa'i skabs mi 'byed de /
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du tshul khrims ngan pa'i skabs mi 'byed de /
translated: “For the sake of those very beings, he does not give them an opportunity to engage in immorality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: It is because he thinks like this:

original: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs la srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun gyi tshig smra ba dang / phra ma can du 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs la srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun gyi tshig smra ba dang / phra ma can du 'gyur ba dang /
translated: ‘I have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and I should not kill living creatures, take what has not been given, engage in sexual misconduct, speak falsely, speak divisively,

original: zhe gcod pa'i tshig smra ba dang / tshig kyal pa can du 'gyur pa dang / chags sems can du 'gyur ba dang / gnod sems su byed pa dang / log par lta ba can du 'gyur ba dang / yul la smon pa dang / lha dang /
analyzed: zhe gcod pa'i tshig smra ba dang / tshig kyal pa can du 'gyur pa dang / chags sems can du 'gyur ba dang / gnod sems su byed pa dang / log par lta ba can du 'gyur ba dang / yul la smon pa dang / lha dang /
translated: speak harshly, engage in idle talk, be covetous, have a malicious mind, or have a distorted view. I should not long for objects, or for gods,

original: tshangs pa dang / nyan thos kyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar smon pa 'di dag ni bdag la tshul dang mi 'dra'o snyam ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / nyan thos kyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar smon pa 'di dag ni bdag la tshul dang mi 'dra'o snyam ste /
translated: “Brahma, shravaka, and pratyekabuddha levels” are not my way.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who thinks like this is practicing the perfection of morality.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du tshig rtsub pa dang brlang bas rtag tu spyos shing brgyad kyang 'khrug pa'i sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du tshig rtsub pa dang brlang bas rtag tu spyos shing brgyad kyang 'khrug pa'i sems mi bskyed /
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings, even if they are constantly scolded and reviled with harsh and abusive words, they do not give rise to an angry mind.

original: rdo dbyug dang / bong pa dang / mtshon gyis btab cing bsnun pa dang / lus kyi yan lag gshigs sam /
analyzed: rdo dbyug dang / bong pa dang / mtshon gyis btab cing bsnun pa dang / lus kyi yan lag gshigs sam /
translated: Even if they are struck with clods of earth, sticks, and swords, and their limbs are cut off,

original: nying lag bcad kyang zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: nying lag bcad kyang zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed do //
translated: they do not give rise to a hateful mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar @140a *//🔽de ni sgra thams cad sgra brnyan lta bur yongs su rtog go /
analyzed: 'di ltar @140a *// de ni sgra thams cad sgra brnyan lta bur yongs su rtog go /
translated: Because they think like this:🔽“All sounds are like echoes.”

original: gzugs thams cad dbu ba lta bur yongs su rtog go /
analyzed: gzugs thams cad dbu ba lta bur yongs su rtog go /
translated: “All forms are like foam.”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who investigates in this way is practicing the perfection of patience.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su btsal ba'i phyir le lo'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su btsal ba'i phyir le lo'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: For the sake of those very sentient beings, he does not give rise to a lazy mind in order to seek out all wholesome roots.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: It is because he thinks like this:

original: mtho ris su skye ba'ang le lo can gyis rnyed par dka' na /
analyzed: mtho ris su skye ba'ang le lo can gyis rnyed par dka' na /
translated: ‘Even rebirth in the higher realms is difficult for the lazy to obtain,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos kyi /
translated: let alone unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bas na bdag gis nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o; ;de dag rtag tu brtson pa mi 'dor bar bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o; ;de dag rtag tu brtson pa mi 'dor bar bya'o snyam ste /
translated: Therefore, until I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I must apply diligence. I must never abandon constant diligence.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who investigates in that way practices the perfection of perseverance.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du sems mi 'khrug pa yin te /
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du sems mi 'khrug pa yin te /
translated: “For the sake of those very beings, he does not become mentally disturbed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /🔽'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan du skye ba'ang sems 'khrugs pas rnyed par dka' na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te / 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan du skye ba'ang sems 'khrugs pas rnyed par dka' na /
translated: It is because he thinks like this:

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lta ci smos kyi /
translated: ‘It is difficult to attain even rebirth in the worldly meditative absorptions, let alone unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, because of mental disturbance.

original: de bas na bdag gis ni nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @140b chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du bdag gi sems ma 'khrugs par bya'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis ni nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @140b chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du bdag gi sems ma 'khrugs par bya'o snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore, until I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I will not become mentally disturbed.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who investigates in that way practices the perfection of concentration.

original: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sems can de dag nyid kyi don du nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: “For the sake of those very beings, he never becomes separated from the perfection of wisdom until he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: It is because he thinks like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma zhugs par rnam pa gzhan gyis sems can yongs su smin par bya bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma zhugs par rnam pa gzhan gyis sems can yongs su smin par bya bar mi nus kyi /
translated: ‘I cannot bring beings to maturity by any other means without entering the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na bdag gis shes rab 'chal pa dang ldan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam yang bskyed par mi bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis shes rab 'chal pa dang ldan pa'i sems 'ga' tsam yang bskyed par mi bya'o snyam ste /
translated: Therefore, I should not give rise to a single thought associated with bad wisdom.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar yongs su rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti: Thus, then, does the Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, work for the weal of all beings.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la tha dad pa ma mchis na /
analyzed: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la tha dad pa ma mchis na /
translated: Subhuti: If the perfections are not differentiated,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji skad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rab ces bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji skad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rab ces bgyi /
translated: why is this perfection of wisdom called the 'best' of the five perfections,

original: gtso bo zhes bgyi /🔽mchog ces bgyi /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bgyi / mchog ces bgyi /
translated: the 'foremost',🔽the 'highest',

original: dam pa zhes bgyi /🔽phul zhes bgyi /🔽gya nom pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bgyi / phul zhes bgyi / gya nom pa zhes bgyi /
translated: the 'supreme',

original: bla na med pa zhes bgyi /🔽gong na med pa zhes bgyi /🔽mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bgyi / gong na med pa zhes bgyi / mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi /
translated: the 'unsurpassed',🔽the 'equal',

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi /🔽bcom ldan @141a *//🔽'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi / bcom ldan @141a *// 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no /
translated: the 'unequalled',🔽and the 'one without which the five perfections do not get the name of perfections'?🔽The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: Subhuti: If the perfection of wisdom is the best of the five perfections,🔽the foremost, etc.

original: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ni rnam pa tha dad pa gang yang med do /
analyzed: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ni rnam pa tha dad pa gang yang med do /
translated: Subhūti, there is no difference at all in the perfections.

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom did not exist, these five perfections would not attain the name of perfections.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten na /
translated: Relying on the perfection of wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: these five perfections attain the name of perfections.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / lus rnam pa tha dad pa rnams ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi drung du phyin na kha dog gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / lus rnam pa tha dad pa rnams ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi drung du phyin na kha dog gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: when different bodies go into the presence of the king of mountains, Mount Meru, they become one color.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten na /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, relying on the perfection of wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: these five perfections attain the name of perfections.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du phyin na /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du phyin na /
translated: If they were to reach the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu kha dog gcig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu kha dog gcig par 'gyur te /
translated: they would have the same color as the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of generosity.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of moral discipline.🔽This is the perfection of patience.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of perseverance.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of concentration.🔽This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i khyad par gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i khyad par gang yang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag la ngo bo nyid med pas de'i phyir @141b khyad par med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la ngo bo nyid med pas de'i phyir @141b khyad par med do //
translated: Because they have no intrinsic nature, therefore there is no difference.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽de ltar chos gang la'ang khyad par ma mchis la /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / de ltar chos gang la'ang khyad par ma mchis la /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Lord,🔽if there is no difference and no distinction between any phenomena,

original: bye brag ma mchis na rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ba ni gang zhig mchis /
analyzed: bye brag ma mchis na rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ba ni gang zhig mchis /
translated: what is it that is to be attained?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po de dag gi rab ces bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po de dag gi rab ces bgyi /
translated: Why is the perfection of wisdom called the best of those five perfections?

original: gtso bo zhes bgyi /🔽mchog ces bgyi /🔽dam pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bgyi / mchog ces bgyi / dam pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the foremost?🔽Why is it called the highest?

original: phul zhes bgyi /
analyzed: phul zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the most excellent?

original: gya nom pa zhes bgyi /🔽bla na med pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bgyi / bla na med pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the sublime?🔽Why is it called the unsurpassed?

original: gong na med pa zhes bgyi /🔽mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gong na med pa zhes bgyi / mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the unequalled?🔽Why is it called the unequaled?

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the equal of the unequaled?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: don rjes su thob par bya ba la chos gang yang bye brag dang khyad par med de /
analyzed: don rjes su thob par bya ba la chos gang yang bye brag dang khyad par med de /
translated: There is no difference or distinction between any phenomena in terms of the attainment of the goal.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang brdar bya na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang brdar bya na /
translated: However, in terms of worldly conventions and expressions,

original: sems can rnams 'khor pa las yongs su gdon pa'i don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor pa las yongs su gdon pa'i don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yod do //
translated: in order to completely liberate beings from saṃsāra, there is the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yod do //
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can de dag la'ang skye ba med /
analyzed: sems can de dag la'ang skye ba med /
translated: Those sentient beings are also non-arisen,

original: 'chi ba med /
analyzed: 'chi ba med /
translated: non-ceased,

original: 'pho ba med /
analyzed: 'pho ba med /
translated: non-transmigrating,

original: 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: 'byung ba med de /
translated: and non-originating.

original: sems can med pas chos thams cad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can med pas chos thams cad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since there are no sentient beings, all dharmas should be known to be non-existent.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, for this reason

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi rab ces bya /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi rab ces bya /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the foremost of these five perfections,🔽is the chief,

original: gtso @142a *// bo zhes bya /🔽mchog ces bya /🔽dam pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gtso @142a *// bo zhes bya / mchog ces bya / dam pa zhes bya /
translated: is the best,🔽is the most excellent,

original: phul zhes bya /🔽gya nom pa zhes bya /
analyzed: phul zhes bya / gya nom pa zhes bya /
translated: is the most sublime,

original: bla na med pa zhes bya /🔽gong na med pa zhes bya /🔽mnyam pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya / gong na med pa zhes bya / mnyam pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: is the unsurpassed,🔽is the unequaled,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is the equal of the unequaled,🔽and is the highest.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / dzambu'i gling gi bud med gang ji snyed pa de dag gi nang na /
analyzed: dper na / dzambu'i gling gi bud med gang ji snyed pa de dag gi nang na /
translated: For example, among all the women in the world,

original: bud med rin po che ni rab ces bya; gtso bo zhes bya /
analyzed: bud med rin po che ni rab ces bya; gtso bo zhes bya /
translated: the precious woman is called the best, the foremost,

original: mchog ces bya /🔽dam pa zhes bya /🔽phul zhes bya /
analyzed: mchog ces bya / dam pa zhes bya / phul zhes bya /
translated: the supreme,🔽the excellent,🔽the sublime,

original: gya nom pa zhes bya /🔽bla na med pa zhes bya /🔽gong na med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya / bla na med pa zhes bya / gong na med pa zhes bya /
translated: the exquisite,🔽the unequaled,🔽the matchless,

original: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: the incomparable,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: and the equal of no one.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab ces bgyi ba dang / gtso bo zhes bgyi ba dang / mchog ces bgyi ba dang / dam pa zhes bgyi ba dang / phul zhes bgyi ba dang / gya nom pa zhes bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab ces bgyi ba dang / gtso bo zhes bgyi ba dang / mchog ces bgyi ba dang / dam pa zhes bgyi ba dang / phul zhes bgyi ba dang / gya nom pa zhes bgyi ba dang /
translated: why is the perfection of wisdom called the best, the foremost, the supreme, the excellent, the sublime, the exquisite,

original: bla na med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / gong na med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi ba de ci las dgongs /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / gong na med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / mnyam pa med pa zhes bgyi ba dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bgyi ba de ci las dgongs /
translated: the unequaled, the matchless, the incomparable, and the equal of no one?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su bzung zhing mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na bder gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su bzung zhing mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na bder gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Subhūti, it is because this perfection of wisdom, having taken up all wholesome dharmas, will stand in the knowledge of all aspects, in such a way that it does not stand.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽shes rab kyi @142b pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / shes rab kyi @142b pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am /
translated: ” Subhūti said,

original: gtong ba mchis sam /
analyzed: gtong ba mchis sam /
translated: “Lord, does the perfection of wisdom take up or give away any dharma?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
translated: “No, Subhūti, it does not.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am gtong ba med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am gtong ba med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not take up or give away any dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba med pa dang gtang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba med pa dang gtang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are ungraspable and ungiveable.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said,🔽“Lord, is the perfection of wisdom the forerunner in taking up all wholesome dharmas?

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad mi 'dzin mi gtong ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad mi 'dzin mi gtong ba lags /
translated: How is it that the perfection of wisdom does not take up or give up any dharma?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not take up or give up form.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not take up or give up feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not take up or give up the constituents, the sense fields, or dependent origination.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not take up or give up all the perfections, all the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not grasp or reject the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions,🔽emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa @143a *//
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa @143a *//
translated: signlessness,

original: dang; smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: dang; smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: wishlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not grasp or reject the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not grasp at, does not let go of, up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ji ltar na gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
translated: how is form not grasped at, not let go of?

original: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
translated: How is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness not grasped at, not let go of?

original: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba lags /
translated: How, up to the knowledge of all aspects, is it not grasped at, not let go of?”🔽The Lord said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / gzugs yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / gzugs yid la mi byed pas /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la mi byed pas /
translated: form is not grasped at, not let go of, because of not attending to form.

original: rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not grasped at, not let go of, because of not attending to consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yid la mi byed pas /
translated: He does not pay attention to the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: He does not grasp or reject dependent origination.

original: pha rol @143b tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: pha rol @143b tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi byed pas /
translated: He does not pay attention to the perfections, the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven aspects of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: He does not grasp or reject the thirty-seven aspects of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: He does not pay attention to the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, or🔽wishlessness.

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yid la mi byed pas /
translated: He does not pay attention to the emptiness meditative stabilization, signless meditative stabilization, or wishless meditative stabilization.

original: gzungs kyi sgo yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: He does not take up or give up the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yid la mi byed pas /
translated: He does not pay attention to the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, or eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: He does not take up or give up the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi byed pas /
translated: He does not pay attention to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: He does not take up or give up the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na gzugs yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: Subhūti, in that way he does not take up or give up form.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba yin no //
translated: He does not take up or give up the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: gal te gzugs yid la mi bgyi /
analyzed: gal te gzugs yid la mi bgyi /
translated: Do not attend to form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la mi bgyi /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la mi bgyi /
translated: Do not attend to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: @144a *// skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yid la mi bgyi /
analyzed: @144a *// skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yid la mi bgyi /
translated: Do not attend to the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi bgyi /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi bgyi /
translated: Do not attend to all the perfections, all the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: Do not attend to the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yid la mi bgyi /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yid la mi bgyi /
translated: or wishlessness. Do not attend to the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yid la mi bgyi /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yid la mi bgyi /
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha should not be attended to.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi bgyi na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi bgyi na /
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects should not be attended to.

original: 'o na / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: 'o na / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gzugs yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: gzugs yid la ma bgyis /
translated: if form is not attended to,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la ma bgyis /
translated: and feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not attended to,

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yid la ma bgyis /
translated: and the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are not attended to,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la ma bgyis /
translated: and all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are not attended to,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med @144b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med @144b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,🔽wishlessness,

analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yid la ma bgyis /
translated: the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways;

analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yid la ma bgyis /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la ma bgyis par dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ji ltar rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rnam par ma 'phel bar yang ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su ma rdzogs par yang ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: And how can the knowledge of all aspects be attained without the six perfections being completed?”

original: rab 'byor / nam gzugs yid la mi byed /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nam gzugs yid la mi byed /
translated: The Lord replied, “Subhūti, when you do not pay attention to form,

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la mi byed /

analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yid la mi byed /
translated: when you do not pay attention to the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination,

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi byed /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar @145a *//

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la ma byas /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu @145b dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /

analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yid la ma byas pas /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and having not attended to them, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.”

original: gsol pa / ci'i slad du de ltar gzugs yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: gsol pa / ci'i slad du de ltar gzugs yid la ma bgyis /
translated: He asked, “Why is it that they do not attend to form?

original: de ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la ma bgyis /
translated: In the same way, they do not pay attention to feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness.

original: de ltar skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: de ltar skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yid la ma bgyis /
translated: In the same way, they do not pay attention to the sensory elements, the sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la ma bgyis /
translated: In the same way, they do not pay attention to all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: In the same way, they do not pay attention to the noble truths, the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yid la ma bgyis /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the higher cognitions, the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de ltar stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yid la ma bgyis /
analyzed: de ltar stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yid la ma bgyis /
translated: In this way, without paying attention to the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @146a *//
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @146a *//
translated: without paying attention to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: byang chub yid la ma bgyis par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: byang chub yid la ma bgyis par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: they will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bam po lnga bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu dgu pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: yid la byed pas ni gal te 'dod pa'i khams sam /🔽gal te gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: yid la byed pas ni gal te 'dod pa'i khams sam / gal te gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: “Subhūti, if you pay attention, you will mix up the desire realm,🔽you will mix up the form realm,

original: gal te gzugs med pa'i khams su 'dre bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa'i khams su 'dre bar 'gyur te /
translated: you will mix up the formless realm.

original: yid la mi byed pas ni gang du yang 'dre bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pas ni gang du yang 'dre bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not pay attention, you will not mix up anything at all.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: chos gang dang yang 'dre bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang dang yang 'dre bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not mix with any phenomenon.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa de gang la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa de gang la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: where will the bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom like this come to rest?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs la gnas par mi 'gyur ro // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who practice like this will not come to rest in form.🔽They will not come to rest in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not come to rest in the sense domains, elements, or dependent origination.
