original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas par mi 'gyur @146b ro; ;'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas par mi 'gyur @146b ro; ;'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: they will not stand in the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the deliverances, the complete freedoms, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, emptiness, signlessness, or wishlessness;

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not stand in the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: up to they will not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽“To illustrate further, Subhūti, if a magician or magician’s apprentice conjures up a great many hundreds of thousands of living beings at the crossroads of a main road and then destroys them, do you think, Subhūti, that there is any being that the magician or magician’s apprentice has conjured up there?”🔽“No, Lord.”🔽“What do you think, Subhūti, is there any being that the magician or magician’s apprentice has destroyed?”🔽“No, Lord.”🔽“What do you think, Subhūti, is there any being that the magician or magician’s apprentice has conjured up there?”🔽“No, Lord.”🔽“What do you think, Subhūti, is there any being that the magician or magician’s apprentice has destroyed?”🔽“No, Lord.”🔽“What do you think, Subhūti, is there any being that the magician or magician’s apprentice has conjured up there?”🔽“No, Lord.”🔽“What do you think, Subhūti, is there any being that the magician or magician’s apprentice has destroyed?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: why does it not stand even in omniscience?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “

original: mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir gang la'ang gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it does not cling, it does not stand anywhere.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de gang la mngon par chags par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de gang la mngon par chags par bya ba'am /
translated: And why is that?🔽Because it does not see any dharma to which it could cling

original: gnas par bya ba'i chos de lta bu gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gnas par bya ba'i chos de lta bu gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: or in which it could stand.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par chags pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par chags pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Subhūti, in this way, bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom without clinging and without standing still.

original: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems shing gang de ltar spyod pa dang / de ltar bsgom pa de ni shes @147a *//
analyzed: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems shing gang de ltar spyod pa dang / de ltar bsgom pa de ni shes @147a *//
translated: If bodhisattva great beings think, ‘Whoever practices and meditates like this

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod /
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa ste /🔽bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa ste / bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: they cultivate the perfection of wisdom.🔽They think, ‘I am practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom mo snyam zhing /
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom mo snyam zhing /
translated: I am cultivating the perfection of wisdom.’

original: gal te de ltar 'du shes na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'du shes na /
translated: If they perceive it like that,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ring du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ring du byed pa yin no //
translated: they are far from the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ring du gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ring du gyur pa de ni /
translated: Those who are far from the perfection of wisdom

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las ring du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las ring du gyur pa yin /
translated: are far from the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity.

original: nang stong pa nyid las ring du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid las ring du gyur pa yin /
translated: They are far from the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar las ring du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar las ring du gyur pa yin /
translated: They are far from the emptiness of essential nature of non-things.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa las ring du gyur pa yin /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa las ring du gyur pa yin / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: They are far from the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.🔽They are far from the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the serial absorptions, the emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par @147b shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo las ring du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par @147b shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo las ring du gyur pa yin /
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad las ring du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad las ring du gyur pa yin /
translated: they are far from the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las ring du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las ring du gyur pa yin /
translated: They are far from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi byed de /
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not cause one to settle down on anything at all.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no settling down on the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang la mngon par chags par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin de la med de /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang la mngon par chags par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin de la med de /
translated: Because it does not have that kind of intrinsic nature on which one could settle down.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'du shes na'ang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'du shes na'ang /
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings have the idea that this is the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: That bodhisattva great being will fall away from the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams par gyur pa de ni /
translated: And whoever falls away from the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: falls away from all dharmas.

original: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
analyzed: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
translated: And if he thinks, ‘The perfection of wisdom incorporates the five perfections,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las yongs su nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las yongs su nyams pa yin no //
translated: that bodhisattva great being will fall away from the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nang stong pa nyid yongs su 'dzin to //🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa @148a *//
analyzed: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nang stong pa nyid yongs su 'dzin to // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa @148a *//
translated: And if he thinks, ‘The perfection of wisdom incorporates inner emptiness,

original: nyid kyi bar du yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
analyzed: nyid kyi bar du yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
translated: That bodhisattva great being has fallen away from the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: If he thinks, ‘The perfection of wisdom incorporates the four applications of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
translated: up to incorporates the eightfold noble path,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
translated: that bodhisattva great being has fallen away from the perfection of wisdom.🔽If he thinks, ‘The perfection of wisdom incorporates the four noble truths,

original: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
translated: If he thinks, ‘The perfection of wisdom holds the emptiness, the signless, the wishless, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
translated: then that bodhisattva great being has fallen away from the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
analyzed: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
translated: If he thinks, ‘The perfection of wisdom holds the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,’🔽then that bodhisattva great being has fallen away from the perfection of wisdom.”🔽“Moreover, Śāriputra, if a bodhisattva great being thinks, ‘The perfection of wisdom holds the knowledge of all aspects,’

original: @148b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: @148b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
translated: then that bodhisattva great being has fallen away from the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
analyzed: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su 'dzin to snyam na'ang /
translated: “If they think, ‘The perfection of wisdom takes hold of , up to the knowledge of all aspects,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin te /
translated: then those bodhisattva great beings have fallen from the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral pas ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral pas ni /
translated: Because they are separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: they are unable to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to snyam na'ang /
analyzed: gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to snyam na'ang /
translated: “If they think, ‘Those who stand in this perfection of wisdom are prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin te /
translated: then those bodhisattva great beings have fallen from the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa ni /
translated: Those who have fallen from the perfection of wisdom

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung mi ston to //🔽gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung mi ston to // gal te yang de 'di snyam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas te /
translated: and he does not prophesy that they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: “If, on the other hand, he thinks, ‘I will stand in this perfection of wisdom and accomplish the perfection of giving of a bodhisattva great being,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: accomplish the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom,

original: nang stong pa nyid mngon par @149a *//
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid mngon par @149a *//
translated: accomplish inner emptiness,

original: bsgrub bo // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: bsgrub bo // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: up to accomplish the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: accomplish the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: He accomplishes the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: He accomplishes the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: and wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mngon par bsgrub po snyam na'ang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mngon par bsgrub po snyam na'ang /
translated: “If they think, ‘I will accomplish the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no //
translated: those bodhisattva great beings have fallen away from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pas ni; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pas ni; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Because having fallen away from the perfection of wisdom they are unable to accomplish the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin @149b pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin @149b pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: they are unable to accomplish the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: they are unable to accomplish the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: up to they are unable to accomplish the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: They are unable to accomplish the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: they are unable to accomplish the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: They are unable to accomplish the noble truths, the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless absorptions, the formless meditative attainments, the gateways of meditative stability, the gateways of meditative absorption, the emptiness gateway to meditative stability,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signless meditative stabilization, the wishless meditative stabilization, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mngon par bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: they are unable to accomplish the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signless meditative stabilization, the wishless meditative stabilization, the five eyes, the six clairvoyances, the four fearlessnesses, the four purities, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the ten powers.

original: gal te yang de 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ste /🔽rang gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bshad @150a *//🔽do; ;bstan to //
analyzed: gal te yang de 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ste / rang gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bshad @150a *// do; ;bstan to //
translated: If they think, ‘The Tathāgata has not fully grasped all dharmas,🔽but has taught,🔽demonstrated,

original: rab tu phye'o snyam na'ang /
analyzed: rab tu phye'o snyam na'ang /
translated: and revealed them after fully awakening to them himself,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: then those bodhisattva great beings have fallen away from the perfection of wisdom. And why?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med de /
translated: The Tathāgata has not fully awakened to any dharma at all.

original: rab 'byor / de'ang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos gang yang 'dogs pa med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'ang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos gang yang 'dogs pa med na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this: since the Tathāgata does not designate any dharma at all,

original: chos la la zhig mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: chos la la zhig mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
translated: how could it be that he has fully awakened to any dharma at all?

original: de ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: That is not possible.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i skyon 'di dag ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i skyon 'di dag ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How will bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom avoid these faults?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: 'di snyam du chos thams cad ni med pa ste yongs su ma bzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du chos thams cad ni med pa ste yongs su ma bzung ba'o //
translated: “He should think, ‘All phenomena are nonexistent and ungraspable.

original: de ltar chos thams cad med cing yongs su ma bzung ba ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so zhes bya bar yang dag par shes te /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad med cing yongs su ma bzung ba ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so zhes bya bar yang dag par shes te /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are nonexistent and ungraspable, and so they cannot be fully awakened to.’

original: gal te de ltar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: If he practices in this way, he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te de ltar yongs su ma bzung ba'i chos thams cad la mngon @150b par chags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yongs su ma bzung ba'i chos thams cad la mngon @150b par chags na /
translated: If he becomes attached to all phenomena, which are ungraspable in this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: then the bodhisattva great being is separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mngon par chags pas brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mngon par chags pas brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not described as attachment.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: ci lags / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba lags sam /
translated: is the perfection of wisdom not separated from the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba lags sam /
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity?

original: nang stong pa nyid nang stong pa nyid dang ma bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid nang stong pa nyid dang ma bral ba lags sam /
translated: Are they not separated from inner emptiness?

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang ma bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang ma bral ba lags sam /
translated: Are they not separated from the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both inner and outer phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities?

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang ma bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang ma bral ba lags sam /
translated: Are they not separated from the applications of mindfulness?

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang; byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang; byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa /
translated: Are they not separated from the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang ma bral ba lags sam /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par @151a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang ma bral ba lags sam / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par @151a *//
translated: Are they not separated from the noble eightfold path?

original: thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang ma bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang ma bral ba lags sam /
translated: Are they not separated from the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness that are doors to liberation, the six clairvoyances, the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang ma bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang ma bral ba lags sam /
translated: Are they not separated from the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba lags sam /
translated: Are they not inseparable from the knowledge of all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: de gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral /
analyzed: de gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom is not separate from the perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang /
translated: if the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving are not separate from the perfection of giving,🔽if the knowledge of paths is not separate from the knowledge of paths,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba zhig lags na ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba zhig lags na ni /
translated: if the knowledge of all aspects is not separate from the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: then how should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished?

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @151b dang; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @151b dang; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice the perfection of meditative stabilization, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: How should they practice up to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs she'am / 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs she'am / 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: do not settle down on ‘form’ or ‘this is form.’

original: 'di'i gzugs so zhes bya bar mngon par chags pa med do //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhe'am /🔽'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gzugs so zhes bya bar mngon par chags pa med do // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhe'am / 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: They do not settle down on ‘this is the form of that.’

original: 'di'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: They do not settle down on ‘feeling,’ ‘perception,’ ‘volitional factors,’ or ‘consciousness’ or ‘this is consciousness.’🔽They do not settle down on ‘this is the consciousness of that.’

original: zhes bya bar mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: zhes bya bar mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to the idea that this is the perfection of giving,

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhe'am /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhe'am /
translated: the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.🔽They are not attached to the idea that this is the emptiness of internal phenomena,🔽the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of the most subtle, the emptiness of the inherent existence of nonthings, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonapprehension, the emptiness of nonexistence, the emptiness of essential nature, or the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings.

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are not attached to the idea that this is the applications of mindfulness,🔽the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bya bar mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'di'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bya bar mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to the idea that this is the perfection of giving,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar zhe'am /🔽'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar zhe'am / 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar mngon par chags pa med do //🔽gzugs rtag pa'am mi rtag par mngon par chags pa med do //🔽tshor ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa'am mi rtag par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar mngon par chags pa med do // gzugs rtag pa'am mi rtag par mngon par chags pa med do // tshor ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa'am mi rtag par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to the idea that this is the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag @152a *//
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag @152a *//
translated: the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of the most subtle, the emptiness of the inherent existence of nonthings, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonapprehension, the emptiness of nonexistence, the emptiness of essential nature, or the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings.

original: pa'am mi rtag par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: pa'am mi rtag par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to the idea that this is the applications of mindfulness,🔽the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rtag pa'am mi rtag par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rtag pa'am mi rtag par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: up to and including omniscience, as permanent or impermanent.

original: gzugs bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on form as happiness or suffering.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as happiness or suffering.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination as happiness or suffering.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar mngon par chags pa med do //🔽gzugs bdag gam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar mngon par chags pa med do // gzugs bdag gam /
translated: They do not get fixated on , up to and including omniscience, as happiness or suffering.🔽They do not get fixated on form as a self

original: bdag med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: bdag med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: or as not a self.

original: tshor ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gam bdag med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gam bdag med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as a self or as not a self.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag gam bdag med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag gam bdag med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination as having a self or being without a self.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bdag gam bdag med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bdag gam bdag med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on the knowledge of all aspects as having a self or being without a self.

original: gzugs zhi ba'am ma zhi bar mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs zhi ba'am ma zhi bar mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on form as being at peace or not at peace.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba'am ma zhi bar mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba'am ma zhi bar mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as being at peace or not at peace.

original: skye mched @152b dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhi ba'am ma zhi bar mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: skye mched @152b dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhi ba'am ma zhi bar mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination as being at peace or not at peace.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zhi ba'am ma zhi bar mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zhi ba'am ma zhi bar mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on the knowledge of all aspects as being at peace or not at peace.

original: gzugs stong pa'am mi stong par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa'am mi stong par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on form as empty or not empty.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa'am mi stong par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa'am mi stong par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the idea that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty or not empty.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa'am mi stong par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa'am mi stong par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the idea that the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are empty or not empty.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong pa'am mi stong par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong pa'am mi stong par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the idea that the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience is empty or not empty.

original: gzugs mtshan ma yod pa'am mtshan ma med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs mtshan ma yod pa'am mtshan ma med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the idea that form is with signs or signless.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma yod pa'am mtshan ma med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma yod pa'am mtshan ma med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the idea that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are with signs or signless.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtshan ma yod pa'am mtshan ma med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtshan ma yod pa'am mtshan ma med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not get attached to the idea that the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are with signs or signless.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mtshan ma yod pa'am mtshan ma med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mtshan ma yod pa'am mtshan ma med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: up to and including omniscience, as having signs or being signless.

original: gzugs smon pa yod pa'am smon pa med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs smon pa yod pa'am smon pa med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on form as having aspirations or not having aspirations.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa yod pa'am smon pa med par mngon par chags pa med do //🔽skye mched dang / @153a *//
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa yod pa'am smon pa med par mngon par chags pa med do // skye mched dang / @153a *//
translated: They do not get fixated on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as having aspirations or not having aspirations.🔽They do not get fixated on the sense fields,

original: khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smon pa yod pa'am smon pa med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smon pa yod pa'am smon pa med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: the elements, or dependent origination as having aspirations or not having aspirations.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du smon pa yod pa'am smon pa med par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du smon pa yod pa'am smon pa med par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on , up to and including omniscience, as having aspirations or not having aspirations.

original: gzugs dben pa'am mi dben par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs dben pa'am mi dben par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not get fixated on form as being isolated or not being isolated.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang; 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'am mi dben par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang; 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'am mi dben par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to the notion that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are with or without voidness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'am mi dben par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dben pa'am mi dben par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to the notion that the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are with or without voidness.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'am mi dben par mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben pa'am mi dben par mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to the notion that , up to and including omniscience, are with or without voidness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rang bzhin med pa'i chos ni rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i chos ni rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: Suviṣṭa­mati, it is because a nonexistent intrinsic nature is not something that can be described as permanent or impermanent,

original: bde zhes bya ba'am sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: bde zhes bya ba'am sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'am /
translated: as happiness or suffering,

original: bdag yod ces ba ba'am bdag med ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag yod ces ba ba'am bdag med ces bya ba'am /
translated: as a self or not a self,

original: zhi zhes bya ba'am ma zhi zhes ba ba'am /
analyzed: zhi zhes bya ba'am ma zhi zhes ba ba'am /
translated: as being peaceful or not peaceful,

original: stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya ba'am /
translated: as empty or not empty,🔽as a sign or signless,

original: mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'am mtshan ma med ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'am mtshan ma med ces bya ba'am /
translated: as having aspirations or lacking aspirations,🔽or as calm or not calm.

original: smon pa yod ces bya ba'am smon pa med ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: smon pa yod ces bya ba'am smon pa med ces bya ba'am /
translated: He cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening as ‘with wishes’ or ‘wish-less,’

original: dben zhes bya ba'am mi dben zhes bya bar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: dben zhes bya ba'am mi dben zhes bya bar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: or as ‘isolated’ or ‘not isolated.’

original: ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis mngon par bsgrub par mi nus te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis mngon par bsgrub par mi nus te /
translated: An intrinsic nature cannot be accomplished by an intrinsic nature.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems @153b dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems @153b dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving will stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ni /
translated: For example, a universal monarch’s four-division army

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der 'gro'o //
translated: Wherever the universal monarch goes, there the four armies go.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: Similarly, Subhūti, these five perfections follow after the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will stand where the knowledge of all aspects stands.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as

original: dper na / kha lo sgyur ba ni rta zung bzhi pa'i shing rta la zhon zhing lam mnyam pa nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: dper na / kha lo sgyur ba ni rta zung bzhi pa'i shing rta la zhon zhing lam mnyam pa nas 'gro'o //
translated: a charioteer, mounted on a four-horse chariot, goes along a level road.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i kha lo sgyur ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i kha lo sgyur ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of wisdom, the charioteer of the five perfections,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der lam mnyam pa nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der lam mnyam pa nas 'gro'o //
translated: goes along the level road to where the knowledge of all aspects is.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ni gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ni gang lags /
translated: what is the path for bodhisattva great beings?

original: lam ma lags pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: lam ma lags pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is not the path?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba la nyan thos kyi lam ni /🔽byang chub @154a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba la nyan thos kyi lam ni / byang chub @154a *//
translated: The Lord said:🔽The path of the śrāvakas is not the path of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ma yin no //🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ni /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ma yin no // rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ni /
translated: for attaining the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ma yin no //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba la shas rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ma yin no // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba la shas rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni /
translated: The path of the pratyekabuddhas is not the path of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas🔽for attaining the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The six perfections with the perfection of wisdom going in front are the path of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ste /
translated: for attaining the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam dang lam ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam dang lam ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the path and not the path of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said:

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lam dang lam ma lags pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lam dang lam ma lags pa ston pa ni /
translated: “Lord, this perfection of wisdom teaches the path and not the path

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas so //
translated: For the bodhisattva great beings it is present for the sake of a great meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lam dang lam ma yin pa ston pas /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lam dang lam ma yin pa ston pas /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don chen po'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of a great meaning for the bodhisattva great beings because it shows the paths and the non-paths.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don tshad med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don tshad med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of immeasurable meaning for the bodhisattva great beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don grangs med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la don grangs med pa'i phyir nye bar gnas te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is present for the sake of innumerable meaning for the bodhisattva great beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol @154b tu phyin pa ni don de'ang brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol @154b tu phyin pa ni don de'ang brjod mod kyi /
translated: The perfection of wisdom does indeed express that meaning,

original: gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: but it does not grasp at form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: or feeling, or perception, or volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gyur ba'i bar du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gyur ba'i bar du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not stand in appropriation in order to appropriate the level of a śrāvaka or the level of a pratyekabuddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su 'thob par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su 'thob par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: This perfection of wisdom does not cause the bodhisattva great beings to obtain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dor ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not cause them to abandon the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sprod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sprod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not bring about the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar chos kyi gnas nyid tshad mar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi gnas nyid tshad mar byas nas /
translated: Thus, having taken the true nature of dharmas as the measure,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang yang bskyed pa ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang yang bskyed pa ma yin /
translated: this perfection of wisdom does not produce any dharma

original: 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: or cause it to cease.

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos gang yang bskyed ba ma lags /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos gang yang bskyed ba ma lags /
translated: If this perfection of wisdom does not produce any dharma at all,

original: 'gog pa ma lags na /
analyzed: 'gog pa ma lags na /
translated: does not stop any dharma at all,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: how should bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: ji ltar sbyin pa yongs su gtang bar bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa yongs su gtang bar bgyi /
translated: give gifts?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims bsrung bar bgyi /🔽ji ltar bzod pa bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims bsrung bar bgyi / ji ltar bzod pa bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they guard morality?🔽How should they cultivate patience?

original: ji ltar brtson 'grus brtsam par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar brtson 'grus brtsam par bgyi /
translated: How should they make an effort?

original: ji ltar bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi /
translated: How should they become absorbed in concentration?

original: ji ltar shes rab bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should they cultivate wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / @155a rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / @155a rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
translated: “Subhūti, you should give gifts with the knowledge of all aspects in mind.🔽You should guard morality with the knowledge of all aspects in mind.

original: tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
translated: You should cultivate patience with the knowledge of all aspects in mind.

original: bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: bzod pa bsgom par bya'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
translated: “One should cultivate patience.

original: brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
translated: One should cultivate effort.

original: bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs te /
translated: One should cultivate concentration.

original: shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate wisdom.

original: des dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
analyzed: des dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
translated: Having made those wholesome roots into something shared in common by all sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: one should dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
translated: When the wholesome roots of the bodhisattva great being have been dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in that way,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the cultivation of the six perfections is completed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The cultivation of the bodhisattva great beings’ love is

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ma bral ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ma bral ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who are not separated from the six perfections are not separated from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par @155b rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par @155b rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should practice the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs nas /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections, having completed all the roots of virtue,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should be diligent in the six perfections.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bgyi /
translated: how should bodhisattva great beings be diligent in the six perfections?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings are not conjoined with form, nor are they disjoined from it.🔽They are not conjoined with feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, nor are they disjoined from it.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: They are not conjoined with the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination, nor are they disjoined from it.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽'phags pa'i bden ba dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang @156a *//
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin / 'phags pa'i bden ba dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang @156a *//
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from any of the perfections, any of the emptinesses, or any of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from the noble truths, the dhyānas, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless absorptions, the aspects of liberation, the aspects of correct understanding, the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the superknowledges, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya bar rab tu brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya bar rab tu brtag par bya ste /
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, is neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, this is how bodhisattva great beings should practice the six perfections.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
