analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings

original: gzugs la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: should not practice thinking, ‘I will stand in form.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not practice thinking, ‘I will stand in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.’

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not practice thinking, ‘I will stand in the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.’

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan @156b ma med pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o // 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan @156b ma med pa dang /
translated: They should not make an effort thinking, ‘I will stand in all the perfections, in all the emptinesses, and in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.’🔽They should not make an effort thinking, ‘I will stand in the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness;

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: in the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.’

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not make an effort thinking, ‘I will stand in the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs ni gang la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: gzugs ni gang la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: Form does not stand anywhere.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni gang la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni gang la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not stand anywhere.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gang la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gang la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: The constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination do not stand anywhere.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni gang la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni gang la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: All the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening do not stand anywhere.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation do not stand anywhere.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni gang la'ang mi gnas so //🔽stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni gang la'ang mi @157a *//🔽gnas so // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni gang la'ang mi gnas pa ste /🔽de ltar mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni gang la'ang mi gnas so // stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni gang la'ang mi @157a *// gnas so // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni gang la'ang mi gnas pa ste / de ltar mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
translated: the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signless meditative stabilization, the wishless meditative stabilization, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways do not stand anywhere;🔽the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha do not stand anywhere;🔽up to the knowledge of all aspects does not stand anywhere.🔽In that way, without standing anywhere, bodhisattva great beings should fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”🔽

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / skyes bu zhig shing thog aa mra'am /🔽pa nas za bar 'dod na /🔽des shing thog aa mra'am /🔽pa na sa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / skyes bu zhig shing thog aa mra'am /🔽pa nas za bar 'dod na /🔽des shing thog aa mra'am /🔽pa na sa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: the emptiness of nonapprehension, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonexistence, the original: bskyed nas kyang dus dus su chus bcu'o //
analyzed: bskyed nas kyang dus dus su chus bcu'o //
translated: and having planted it, he would from time to time water it.

original: gnod pa bsal lo //
analyzed: gnod pa bsal lo //
translated: He would remove the weeds,

original: de rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis mthar gyis 'phel na /🔽shing thog aa mra'am /
analyzed: de rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis mthar gyis 'phel na / shing thog aa mra'am /
translated: and if it grew gradually by the power of the combination of causes and conditions,

original: pa na sa yod par 'gyur te /🔽de shing thog aa mra'am /
analyzed: pa na sa yod par 'gyur te / de shing thog aa mra'am /
translated: it would become a mango or breadfruit tree,🔽and when it had fruit,

original: shing thog pa nas za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing thog pa nas za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he would eat the mango or breadfruit.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslabs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslabs te /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment should train in the six perfections,

original: sems can rnams sbyin pas rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams sbyin pas rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: and they should help beings with generosity,

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyis rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyis rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: and they should help them with morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom.

original: sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: They should liberate beings from cyclic existence.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'dod pa dang / sangs @157b rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang bar 'dod pa dang / snying po byang chub tu 'dug par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'dod pa dang / sangs @157b rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang bar 'dod pa dang / snying po byang chub tu 'dug par 'dod pa dang /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to not be led by others, who want to purify a buddhafield, who want to sit on the terrace of enlightenment,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'dod pas /
translated: and who want to turn the wheel of the Dharma

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in the six perfections.

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,🔽do you say, ‘The perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsung ngam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsung ngam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom’?🔽”🔽The Lord said, “Subhūti, I say, ‘The perfection of wisdom

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes smra'o //
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom.’

original: chos thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ba thob par 'dod pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ba thob par 'dod pas /
translated: I say, ‘Those who want to attain mastery over all dharmas

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes smra'o //
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis chos thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ba'i sa thob par 'gyur ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad la dbang du 'gyur ba'i sa thob par 'gyur ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is that by which one attains the stage of mastery over all phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the gateway to all phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po ni chu klung thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po ni chu klung thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: for example, the great ocean is the gateway for all rivers.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is the gateway for all phenomena.

original: gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: Whether it is a person of the vehicle of the hearers,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: the vehicle of the solitary buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: or the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, they should train in just this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i @158a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i @158a *//
translated: the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration, and

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //🔽phyi stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o // phyi stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “They should train in the emptiness of internal phenomena,🔽they should train in the emptiness of external phenomena,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: they should train in the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
translated: up to they should train in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “They should train in the four applications of mindfulness,

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and similarly they should train in the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness gateways to liberation,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang; smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang; smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bslab par bya'o //
translated: the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang; so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang; so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bslab par bya'o //
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the great love, the great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @158b pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @158b pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / 'phong gi slob dpon lag tshod dang 'byor pa'i gzhu thogs pa ni dgra dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis thub bar dka'o; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: dper na / 'phong gi slob dpon lag tshod dang 'byor pa'i gzhu thogs pa ni dgra dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis thub bar dka'o; ;rab 'byor /
translated: For example, Subhūti, it is difficult for enemies and adversaries to overcome an archer who is skilled in archery and who is armed with a bow.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis thub par dka'o //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, it is difficult for Māra or the gods in Māra’s retinue to overcome a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
translated: “Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: The lord buddhas of the past, future, and present pay attention to those who practice the perfection of wisdom in that way.”

original: gsol pa / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: gsol pa / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: He asked, “How do the lord buddhas pay attention to bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: How do they pay attention to those practicing the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: How do they pay attention to those practicing inner emptiness?

original: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la @159a *//🔽spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la @159a *//🔽spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: How do they pay attention to those practicing up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: ji ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang; byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang; byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: How does he intend to teach the practice of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the  pervaded by emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the higher cognitions, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: How do they intend to teach the practice of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad /
translated: How do they intend to teach the practice of the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: “Subhūti, here the lord buddhas intend to teach the practice of the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of giving,

original: ci nas kyang sbyin pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang sbyin pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: intending that they not apprehend a gift.

original: tshul khrims @159b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: tshul khrims @159b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci nas kyang shes rab mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang shes rab mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: He sets his mind on the practice of wisdom in such a way that wisdom is not apprehended.

original: nang stong pa nyid spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: He sets his mind on the practice of inner emptiness,

original: ci nas kyang nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: in such a way that inner emptiness is not apprehended.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: He sets his mind on the practice of . . . up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: ci nas kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: in such a way that the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is not apprehended.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: He sets his mind on the practice of the applications of mindfulness,

original: ci nas kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: He thinks about the applications of mindfulness in such a way that he does not even apprehend the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: He thinks about the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path in such a way that he does not even apprehend the path.

original: ci nas kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: He thinks about the noble truths in such a way that he does not even apprehend the noble truths.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /🔽smon pa med pa @160a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /🔽smon pa med pa @160a *//
translated: He thinks about the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways,

original: dang; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: dang; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /
translated: and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: ci nas kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /🔽ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mi dmigs pa de ltar dgongs pa mdzad do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du spyod pa la dgongs pa mdzad de /

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la gzugs su dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la gzugs su dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Lord Buddhas do not consider the bodhisattva great beings as form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not consider them as feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not consider them as the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not consider them as the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan @160b gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan @160b gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not consider them as the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not consider them as inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: up to and including the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par dgongs pa mi mdzad do //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par dgongs pa mi mdzad do // 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: He does not intend the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of awakening, or the noble eightfold path.🔽He does not intend the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, the emptiness gate of liberation,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang; gzungs kyi sgor dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang; gzungs kyi sgor dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilities, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams su dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams su dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: He does not intend the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dgongs pa mi mdzad do //
translated: He does not intend up to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gnas mang por yang bslab par bgyi la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gnas mang por yang bslab par bgyi la /
translated: bodhisattva great beings should train in many situations

original: gang la'ang bslab par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: gang la'ang bslab par mi bgyi'o //
translated: and should not train in any.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so.

original: de de bzhin te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' @161a *//
analyzed: de de bzhin te / byang chub sems dpa' @161a *//
translated: It is just as you have said.🔽Bodhisattva great beings should train in many situations

original: sems dpa' chen pos gnas mang por yang bslab par bya ste gang la'ang bslab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen pos gnas mang por yang bslab par bya ste gang la'ang bslab par mi bya'o //
translated: and should not train in any.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ba'i chos de dag mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya ba'i chos de dag mi dmigs so //
translated: Because those dharmas in which bodhisattva great beings should train are not apprehended.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par bstan na /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par bstan na /
translated: when the Thus-Gone One has taught these phenomena in brief and in detail,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal bas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal bas /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par kun chub par bgyi'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag mdo dang rgyas par kun chub par bgyi'o //
translated: should master these six perfections in brief and in detail.

original: kun chub par bgyi nas tshig gis shin tu goms par bgyi'o //
analyzed: kun chub par bgyi nas tshig gis shin tu goms par bgyi'o //
translated: Having mastered them, they should become very familiar with them through words.

original: tshig gis shin tu goms par bgyis nas yid kyis rtogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: tshig gis shin tu goms par bgyis nas yid kyis rtogs par bgyi'o //
translated: Having become very familiar with them through words, they should understand them with their minds.

original: de'ang ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi rgyu ba de ltar rtogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de'ang ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi rgyu ba de ltar rtogs par bgyi'o //
translated: And they should understand them in such a way that the mind and mental factors do not operate.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po mdo dang rgyas par bstan pa 'di dag la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po mdo dang rgyas par bstan pa 'di dag la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in these six perfections, taught in brief and in detail, will know the brief and detailed presentations of all phenomena.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa 'tshal bar 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa 'tshal bar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: how will the bodhisattva mahāsattva know the brief and detailed presentations of all phenomena?”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @161b pa; gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid shes na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @161b pa; gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid shes na /
translated: “If you know the suchness of form,

original: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: you will know the brief and detailed presentations of all phenomena.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid shes na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid shes na /
translated: If you know the suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: you will know the brief and detailed presentations of all phenomena.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid shes na /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid shes na /
translated: If you know the suchness of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination,

original: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will know the concise and extensive teachings of all phenomena.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid shes na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid shes na /
translated: If they know the suchness of all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro // 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: they will know the concise and extensive teachings of all phenomena.🔽If they know the suchness of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi de bzhin nyid shes na /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi de bzhin nyid shes na /
translated: wishlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will know the concise and extensive teachings of all phenomena.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid shes na /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid shes na /
translated: If they know the suchness of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will know the brief and extensive of all dharmas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid shes na /🔽chos thams @162a *//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid shes na / chos thams @162a *//
translated: If they know the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will know the brief and extensive of all dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: “Lord, what is the suchness of form?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: de bzhin nyid gang la skye ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang la skye ba mi dmigs /
translated: “The suchness of form is that suchness in which arising is not apprehended,

original: 'jig pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'jig pa mi dmigs /
translated: in which passing away is not apprehended,

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: in which remaining is not apprehended, and in which otherness is not apprehended.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings should train in that.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said,🔽“Lord, what is the suchness of form?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: What is the suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: What is the suchness of , up to and including omniscience?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Su­bhūti, the suchness of form is the suchness of feeling, perception, and volitional factors.

original: de bzhin nyid gang la skye ba mi dmigs /🔽'jig pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang la skye ba mi dmigs / 'jig pa mi dmigs /
translated: The suchness of volitional factors is the suchness of consciousness.🔽The suchness of consciousness is the suchness of the eyes.🔽The suchness of the eyes is the suchness of the ears.🔽The suchness of the ears is the suchness of the nose.🔽The suchness of the nose is the suchness of the tongue.🔽The suchness of the tongue is the suchness of the body.🔽The suchness of the body is the suchness of the mental faculty.🔽The suchness of the mental faculty is the suchness of sights.🔽The suchness of sights is the suchness of sounds.🔽The suchness of sounds is the suchness of odors.🔽The suchness of odors is the suchness of tastes.🔽The suchness of tastes is the suchness of tangibles.🔽The suchness of tangibles is the suchness of mental phenomena.🔽The suchness of mental phenomena is the suchness of the sensory element of the eyes.🔽The suchness of the sensory element of the eyes is the suchness of the sensory element of sights.

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid de /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid de / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
translated: The suchness of the sensory element of sights is the suchness of the sensory element of visual consciousness.🔽The suchness of the sensory element of visual consciousness is the suchness of the sensory element of the ears.

original: de bzhin nyid gang la skye ba mi dmigs /🔽'jig pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang la skye ba mi dmigs / 'jig pa mi dmigs so //
translated: The suchness of the sensory element of the ears is the suchness of the sensory element of sounds.🔽The suchness of the sensory element of sounds is the suchness of the sensory element of auditory consciousness.🔽The suchness of the sensory element of auditory consciousness is the suchness of the sensory element of the nose.🔽The suchness of the sensory element of the nose is the suchness of the sensory element of odors.🔽The suchness of the sensory element of odors is the suchness of the sensory element of olfactory consciousness.🔽The suchness of the sensory element of olfactory consciousness is the suchness of the sensory element of the tongue.🔽The suchness of the sensory element of the tongue is the suchness of the sensory element of tastes.

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness of the sensory element of tastes is the suchness of the sensory element

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab @162b par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab @162b par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas should train in that.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' shes na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' shes na /
translated: “If they know the limit of reality,

original: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will know the concise and extensive of all phenomena.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i mtha' gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i mtha' gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One, what is the limit of reality?”

original: mtha' med pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: mtha' med pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “The limit of reality is the absence of limits.

original: mtha' 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: mtha' 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas who train in this limit

original: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: will know the concise and extensive of all phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings shes na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shes na /
translated: “If they know the realm of phenomena,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; chos kyi dbyings gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; chos kyi dbyings gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas will know the concise and extensive of all phenomena.”🔽Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One, what is the realm of phenomena?”

original: dbyings med pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: dbyings med pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “The realm of phenomena is the absence of a realm.

original: chos kyi dbyings de la chad pa dang / yongs su chad pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de la chad pa dang / yongs su chad pa mi dmigs so //
translated: In that dharma-dhātu, there is no apprehension of a break or a complete break.

original: chos kyi dbyings de ltar shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de ltar shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who knows the dharma-dhātu in that way will know the concise and extensive of all dharmas.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Bhagavān,

original: ji ltar chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa 'tshal bar bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa 'tshal bar bgyi /
translated: how should I know the concise and extensive of all dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: ci nas kyang chos thams cad ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang chos thams cad ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: “You should know that all dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ldan pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ldan pa'ang ma lags /
translated: He said, “Bhagavān,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma lags pa'i chos de dag kyang gang lags /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma lags pa'i chos de dag kyang gang lags /
translated: what are those dharmas that are neither conjoined nor disjoined?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽gzugs ldan pa'ang ma @163a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / gzugs ldan pa'ang ma @163a *//
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: “Form is neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither conjoined nor disjoined;

original: skye mched dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched dang; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination are neither conjoined nor disjoined;

original: pho rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: pho rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are neither conjoined nor disjoined;

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //🔽'dus byas kyi khams ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no // de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no // 'dus byas kyi khams ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of other-existence, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: Non-things are neither associated with nor disassociated from non-things.

original: de ltar chos thams cad shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad shes par bya'o //
translated: In this way, all dharmas should be understood.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, this is the summary of the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
translated: The beginner bodhisattva great beings should train in this summary perfection.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la gnas te mdor bsdus pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la gnas te mdor bsdus pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: They should train in the summary while standing on the ten bodhisattva stages.

original: mdor bsdus pa 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who train in this summary will know the summary and the details of all dharmas.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po rnon pos rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po rnon pos rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, this is the realization of the bodhisattva great beings with sharp faculties.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po zhan pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur pa'o //🔽'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po 'bring pos kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po zhan pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur pa'o // 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po 'bring pos kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Subhuti, this is something that even a Bodhisattva of weak faculties can understand.🔽This is something that even a Bodhisattva of middling faculties can understand.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po mnyam par bzhag pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /🔽'di ni slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gis kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur @164a *//
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dbang po mnyam par bzhag pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba ste / 'di ni slob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gis kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur @164a *//
translated: This is something that even a Bodhisattva of concentrated faculties can understand.

original: ba med do //
analyzed: ba med do //
translated: There is nothing that a Bodhisattva who wishes to train cannot understand.

original: 'di ni le lo can gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni le lo can gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: This is not something that the lazy can understand.

original: brtson 'grus zhan pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /🔽dran pa nyams pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus zhan pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin / dran pa nyams pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: This is not something that the weak can understand.🔽This is not something that the forgetful can understand.

original: sems 'khrugs pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems 'khrugs pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not something that the confused can understand.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa /🔽le lo med pa /
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa /🔽le lo med pa /
translated: This is something that the diligent can understand.🔽This is something that the energetic can understand.

original: dran pa nye bar gnas pas rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas pas rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and through the establishment of mindfulness, one will realize .

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la slob par 'dod cing /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la slob par 'dod cing /
translated: “One who wishes to train on the irreversible ground

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and who wishes to attain the knowledge of all aspects will realize .

original: gal te ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob cing /
analyzed: gal te ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob cing /
translated: If one trains in the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas /
translated: and trains in the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed na /
translated: and causes the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: then, when those bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud kyi las ci byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi las ci byung yang rung ste /
translated: whatever works of Māra occur,

original: de dag thams cad 'byung ba nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'byung ba nyid kyi tshe /
translated: All of these will be completely abandoned

original: rab tu spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: just by their arising.

original: de bas de thabs mkhas pa yongs su gzung bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas de thabs mkhas pa yongs su gzung bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to take up skillful means should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' @164b sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' @164b sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom, cultivates the perfection of wisdom, and strives in the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag na /
translated: at that time, in countless world systems,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag la dgongs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag la dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: All the lord buddhas who are present, live, and remain in the world systems in the ten directions, and who teach the dharma, they too are intent on the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag las byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag las byung ba ni /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
translated: The lord buddhas of the past, future, and present have come forth from these six perfections.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should reflect as follows:

original: chos gang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis brnyes par gyur pa dang / brnyes pa dang / brnyes par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag gis kyang thob par bya'o snyam du brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: chos gang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis brnyes par gyur pa dang / brnyes pa dang / brnyes par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag gis kyang thob par bya'o snyam du brtag par bya ste /
translated: “I too should attain those dharmas which have been attained by the past, future, and present Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and which will be attained.”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar brtson par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is how Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom should strive.

original: de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who strive like that will quickly awaken fully to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: @165a *// rab 'byor /
analyzed: @165a *// rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar bya ste /
translated: therefore Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should not be separated from keeping in mind the knowledge of path aspects.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du de ltar spyod na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du de ltar spyod na /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being practices in that way for the sake of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: chung du ni se gol gtogs pa tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom yang /
analyzed: chung du ni se gol gtogs pa tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom yang /
translated: even if it is only for as long as it takes to snap one’s fingers,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel gyi /
translated: the bodhisattva great being’s merit would increase much more.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag sbyin pas yongs su tshim par byas pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu bkod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag sbyin pas yongs su tshim par byas pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu bkod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: Compared to the merit of those sentient beings in the great billionfold world system who have been satisfied with gifts, who have been established in morality, who have been established in meditative stabilization,

original: shes rab la rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par grol ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: shes rab la rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par grol ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: nor in the knowledge of liberation, nor in the fruit of stream enterer, nor in the fruit of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pas ni ma yin te /
translated: nor in the fruit of non-returner, nor in the state of a worthy one, nor in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di se gol gtogs pa tsam du bsgom pa de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di se gol gtogs pa tsam du bsgom pa de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The merit that is from meditating on this deep perfection of wisdom for just the time of a finger snap is much greater than that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam @165b par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam @165b par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,🔽the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,🔽the fruit of arhatship,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni 'di las byung ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni 'di las byung ste /
translated: and individual enlightenment.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ngo //
translated: All the lord buddhas in the world systems of the ten directions🔽who are present, live, and teach the Dharma have come forth from this perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las byung ngo //
translated: Those lord buddhas who have passed into nirvāṇa, who have not yet come, and who are present have come forth from this very perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gang skad 'ga' ma /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gang skad 'ga' ma /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, if someone were to practice this perfection of wisdom for one day, with attention focused on the knowledge of all aspects, the merit from that would be much greater than the previous.

original: nyi ma 'ga' ma /
analyzed: nyi ma 'ga' ma /
translated: If someone were to practice it for half a day,

original: nyi ma brgya'am /
analyzed: nyi ma brgya'am /
translated: or for a hundred days,

original: lo 'ga'am / lo brgya'am /🔽bskal pa 'ga' ma /
analyzed: lo 'ga'am / lo brgya'am / bskal pa 'ga' ma /
translated: or for a year, or for a hundred years,🔽or for a hundred eons,🔽or for a thousand eons,🔽or for a hundred thousand eons,🔽or for a hundred million eons,🔽or for a hundred billion eons,

original: bskal pa brgya nas /🔽bskal pa grangs med pa brgya'i bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i yid la byas pas bsgom pa de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel gyi /
analyzed: bskal pa brgya nas / bskal pa grangs med pa brgya'i bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i yid la byas pas bsgom pa de'i bsod nams ni ches mang du 'phel gyi /
translated: or for a hundred trillion eons,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: or for even more than that, for as many eons as there are sands in the Ganges River,🔽if someone were to practice this perfection of wisdom with attention focused on the knowledge of all aspects, the merit from that would be much greater than the previous.🔽If all the sentient beings in as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges River were established in generosity, established in discipline, established in concentration, established in wisdom, established in liberation, and established in the vision of wisdom of liberation,

original: sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag thams cad sbyin pa la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu bkod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang; rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gang ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag thams cad sbyin pa la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshul khrims la rab tu bkod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang; rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: and if someone were to establish all of them in the ten wholesome actions,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu @166a *//
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu @166a *//
translated: and established in the result of stream enterer,🔽the result of once-returner,🔽the result of non-returner,

original: bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: arhatship, and individual enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?🔽Those lord buddhas who have taught the meritorious deeds that consist in giving,

original: gang gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / tshul khrims dang bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: gang gis sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / tshul khrims dang bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: the meritorious deeds that consist in morality, the meritorious deeds that consist in meditation, the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub bstan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang 'di las byung ngo //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub bstan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang 'di las byung ngo //
translated: the result of non-returner, arhatship, and individual enlightenment, have all arisen from this.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who abides in the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught should be known as irreversible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa 'di dang ldan pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang thabs mkhas pa 'di dang ldan pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses this skillful means should be known as contemplated by the Tathāgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po bsnyen bkur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po bsnyen bkur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has served many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddhas.
