original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par rig par bya'o //
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has planted wholesome roots.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin bar rig par bya'o //
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as one who has been taken hold of by a spiritual friend.

original: @166b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @166b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has practiced the six perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stong pa nyid bcu bzhi la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stong pa nyid bcu bzhi la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has cultivated the fourteen emptinesses.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has cultivated the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva has cultivated the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bsgoms par rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la bsgoms bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bsgoms par rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la bsgoms bar rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as one who has cultivated the emptiness of the inconceivable, the emptiness of the unanalyzed, and the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽He should be known as one who has cultivated the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-repudiation, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of essential nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan par rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzhon nur gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan par rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzhon nur gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as one who has cultivated the emptiness of the inconceivable, the emptiness of the unanalyzed, and the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽He should be known as one who has cultivated the emptiness of the subject, the emptiness of the object, the emptiness of both, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of non-observation, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of essence, the emptiness of ultimate reality, and the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽He should be known as one who has cultivated the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-repudiation, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of essential nature.🔽He should be known as one who has cultivated the emptiness of the inconceivable, the emptiness of the unanalyzed, and the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral @167a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral @167a *//
translated: He should be known as one who has cultivated the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the

original: bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The middle is to be understood.🔽🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is not separated from the roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang mi 'bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who is not separated from the buddhafields.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni spobs pa mi chod pa dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni spobs pa mi chod pa dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has uninterrupted eloquence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzungs rab tu thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzungs rab tu thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has attained retention.🔽He should be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has perfected retention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzungs yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni lung bstan pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzungs yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni lung bstan pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has attained the perfection of prophecy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni ched du bsams shing srid pa 'dod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni ched du bsams shing srid pa 'dod par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who intentionally desires existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam par rtogs par bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam par rtogs par bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in conceptualization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni lung bstan pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni lung bstan pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in prophecy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni yi ge dang yi ge med pa rtogs par bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni yi ge dang yi ge med pa rtogs par bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in the realization of letters and the absence of letters.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par spyod pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par spyod pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in the bodhisattva’s way of life.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems @167b dpa' chen po de ni brjod pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems @167b dpa' chen po de ni brjod pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in expression.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni brjod pa med pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni brjod pa med pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in inexpressibility.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gcig gi lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang / gnyis kyi lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang / mang po'i lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang / bud med kyi lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gcig gi lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang / gnyis kyi lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang / mang po'i lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang / bud med kyi lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang /
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in the singular, dual, and plural, skilled in the feminine,

original: skyes pa'i lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang / ma ning gi lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang / ma ning gi lhag pa'i tshig la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: masculine, and neuter,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'das pa dang; ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'das pa dang; ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: and skilled in the past, future, and present.”

original: bam po drug cu pa /
analyzed: bam po drug cu pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzugs la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzugs la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in form,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings are skilled in feelings, perceptions, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽“Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings are skilled in the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang /
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings are skilled in all the perfections, all the emptinesses,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la mkhas par @168a *//🔽rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la mkhas par @168a *// rig par bya'o //
translated: and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings are skilled in the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in emptiness, the signless, the wishless, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the buddhadharmas of the tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in the knowledge of path aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: That bodhisattva great being should be known as skilled in nirvāṇa up to nirvāṇa.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in the defining mark of the dharma-constituent.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / bdag gi dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / 'du ba dang / 'bral ba dang / 'du 'bral dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / bdag gi dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / 'du ba dang / 'bral ba dang / 'du 'bral dang ldan pa dang /
translated: the characteristics of the conditioned, the characteristics of the unconditioned, things, non-things, one’s own thing, another’s thing, combination, separation, being endowed with combination and separation,

original: mi ldan pa dang / ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pa la mkhas par rig @168b par bya'o //
analyzed: mi ldan pa dang / ldan pa'ang ma yin mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pa la mkhas par rig @168b par bya'o //
translated: not being endowed, and neither being endowed nor not being endowed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin nyid la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin nyid la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that bodhisattva mahāsattvas are skilled in suchness.

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are skilled in the unerring thusness, the unaltered thusness, the nature of phenomena, the realm of phenomena, the establishment of phenomena, the faultlessness of phenomena, the limit of reality, and the inconceivable realm.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rgyu dang / rkyen dang / rkyen med pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rgyu dang / rkyen dang / rkyen med pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as skilled in causes, conditions, and the absence of conditions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams dang / khams yod pa dang / khams med pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams dang / khams yod pa dang / khams med pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as skilled in the composite element, the noncomposite element, the element that exists, and the element that does not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzugs yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig bar bya'o //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzugs yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig bar bya'o // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as skilled in not attending to form.🔽He should be known as skilled in not attending to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in not attending to the sense fields, the elements, and dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas @169a *//
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o // 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas @169a *//
translated: “They should be known as skilled in not attending to all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽“They should be known as skilled in not attending to the four noble truths, the dhyānas, the immeasurable medi­tations, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the

original: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: higher knowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la mi bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “They should be known as skilled in not attending to the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi bya ba la mkhas bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi bya ba la mkhas bar rig par bya'o //
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, should be understood as skill in mental nonengagement.

original: gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “One should understand skill in the emptiness of form as form.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as consciousness.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the constituents and sense fields as the constituents and sense fields.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //🔽skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o // skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand skill in the emptiness of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening as the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽“One should understand skill in the emptiness of the perfections as the perfections.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of all the emptinesses as all the emptinesses.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening as the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas as the ten powers of the tathāgatas.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha as the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects as the knowledge of all aspects.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of paths as the knowledge of paths.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all bases as the knowledge of all bases.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all bases as the knowledge of all bases.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all bases as the knowledge of all bases.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all bases as the knowledge of all bases.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all bases as the knowledge of all bases.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all bases as the knowledge of all bases.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all bases as the knowledge of all bases.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all bases as the knowledge of all bases.🔽One should understand skill in the emptiness of the knowledge of all bases as the knowledge of all bases.🔽One should understand skill in the

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa @169b dang; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa @169b dang; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: the higher cognitions, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are empty of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi sa stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi sa stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du /
translated: up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “He is skilled in the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rab tu sbyangs pa'i lam dang / rab tu ma sbyangs pa'i lam dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rab tu sbyangs pa'i lam dang / rab tu ma sbyangs pa'i lam dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
translated: “He is skilled in the path of training and the path of no training, in origination and cessation, in abiding and change, in desire, hatred,

original: gti mug la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: and confusion.

original: 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “He is skilled in the absence of desire, hatred, and confusion.

original: lta ba dang / lta ba med pa dang / log par lta ba dang / log par lta ba med pa dang / lta ba thams cad kyi bar la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang / lta ba med pa dang / log par lta ba dang / log par lta ba med pa dang / lta ba thams cad kyi bar la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “He is skilled in views, in the absence of views, in wrong views, in the absence of wrong views, and in all views.

original: ming la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ming la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “He is skilled in names.

original: ming dang gzugs dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po dang / rnam pa dang / mtshan nyid la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po dang / rnam pa dang / mtshan nyid la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that it is skill in name and form, skill in object, skill in the dominant condition, skill in the aspect, and skill in the characteristic.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that it is skill in suffering, skill in origination, skill in cessation, and skill in the path.

original: sems @170a *// can dmyal ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems @170a *// can dmyal ba dang / sems can dmyal ba'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that it is skill in the hells and skill in the path to the hells.

original: byol song gi skye gnas dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that it is skill in the animal realm and skill in the path to the animal realm.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that it is skill in the world of Yama and skill in the path to the world of Yama.

original: mi dang / mi'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dang / mi'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that it is skill in humans and skill in the path to humans.

original: mi ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that it is skill in non-humans and skill in the path to non-humans.

original: lha dang / lha'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lha dang / lha'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that it is skill in gods and skill in the path to gods.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “One should know that they are skilled in the fruit of stream enterer and the path to the fruit of stream enterer.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “One should know that they are skilled in the fruit of once-returner and the path to the fruit of once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “One should know that they are skilled in the fruit of non-returner and the path to the fruit of non-returner.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'i lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “One should know that they are skilled in the state of a worthy one and the path to the state of a worthy one.

original: rang byang chub dang; rang byang chub kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang byang chub dang; rang byang chub kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “One should know that they are skilled in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening and the path to a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “One should know that they are skilled in the knowledge of path aspects and the path to the knowledge of path aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: “One should know that they are skilled in the knowledge of all aspects and the path to the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that should train in the perfection of giving.

original: dbang po la mkhas pa dang / dbang po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la mkhas @170b par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po la mkhas pa dang / dbang po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la mkhas @170b par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in the faculties and skilled in perfecting the faculties.

original: shes rab myur ba dang / shes rab rno ba dang / shes rab mgyogs pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab dang / yangs pa'i shes rab dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i shes rab la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab myur ba dang / shes rab rno ba dang / shes rab mgyogs pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab dang / yangs pa'i shes rab dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i shes rab la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in quick wisdom, sharp wisdom, swift wisdom, discerning wisdom, vast wisdom, and unequaled wisdom.

original: 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in the past, future, and present.

original: thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in means.

original: sems can gyi sems dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in the thoughts, intentions, and superior intentions of sentient beings.

original: don dang / yi ge dang / theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don dang / yi ge dang / theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: He should be known as skilled in the meaning, the words, and the presentation of the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de la legs pa 'di dag yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa de la legs pa 'di dag yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that these are the advantages for a bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom, who actualizes the perfection of wisdom, and who cultivates the perfection of wisdom.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
translated: how should one practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: How should one actualize the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should one cultivate the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gzugs zhi ba dang / gzugs rag las pa dang / gzugs gsog dang / gzugs snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhi ba dang / gzugs rag las pa dang / gzugs gsog dang / gzugs snying po med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: “You should practice the perfection of wisdom because form is peaceful, because form is dependent, because form is hollow, and because form is insubstantial.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba dang / rnam @171a *//
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba dang / rnam @171a *//
translated: because consciousness is not a being,🔽because consciousness is not a personality,🔽because consciousness is not a person,🔽because consciousness is isolated,🔽because consciousness is dependent,🔽because consciousness is hollow,

original: par shes pa rag las pa dang / rnam par shes pa gsog dang / rnam par shes pa snying po med pas /
analyzed: par shes pa rag las pa dang / rnam par shes pa gsog dang / rnam par shes pa snying po med pas /
translated: and because consciousness is insubstantial,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: one should practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽because the sense spheres, the elements, and dependent origination are calm,🔽because dependent origination is empty,🔽because dependent origination is not a self,🔽because dependent origination is not a being,

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa zhi ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rag las pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsog dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba snying po med pas /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa zhi ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rag las pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsog dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba snying po med pas /
translated: because dependent origination is not a personality,🔽because dependent origination is not a person,🔽because dependent origination is isolated,🔽because dependent origination is dependent,🔽because dependent origination is hollow,🔽and because dependent origination is insubstantial,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: one should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya zhes zer ba ni /
translated: “Moreover, as for what you said about how the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished,

original: nam mkha'i stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrubs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrubs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: By accomplishing the emptiness of space, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom par bya zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom par bya zhes zer ba ni /
translated: And as for what you have said, “How should one cultivate the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bsgom pa rnam par bsgoms bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam par bsgoms bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By cultivating the cultivation, the perfection of wisdom should be cultivated.🔽Subhūti said:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: how long should bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yun ring po ji srid cig tu spyod na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yun ring po ji srid cig tu spyod na /
translated: practice the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par 'gyur /
translated: before they practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: From the first production of the thought of awakening

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: up to sitting on the seat of awakening, they should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: They should accomplish it in that way.

original: de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate in that way.

original: @171b gsol pa /
analyzed: @171b gsol pa /
translated: He said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar sems kyi rgyun ma chad pa dang / ma bral bar spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi rgyun ma chad pa dang / ma bral bar spyad par bgyi /
translated: how should one practice without interrupting the continuity of mind and without being separated from it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi dbye bas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba mi 'dor bas /
analyzed: yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi dbye bas; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba mi 'dor bas /
translated: “One should practice the perfection of wisdom without giving any opportunity to other mental engagements.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya /
translated: One should practice the perfection of wisdom without abandoning the mental engagement of omniscience.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya /
translated: One should accomplish the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi rgyu ba de ltar spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos mi rgyu ba de ltar spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice in such a way that the mind and mental factors do not operate.

original: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish it in that way.

original: de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate it in that way.”🔽He said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas /
analyzed: ci lags / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang / shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas /
translated: “Is it because of practicing the perfection of wisdom,🔽accomplishing the perfection of wisdom,🔽and cultivating the perfection of wisdom?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram /
translated: “Is it the case that the knowledge of all aspects is attained by practicing the perfection of wisdom, by accomplishing the perfection of wisdom, by cultivating the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa; 'o na ci lags /
analyzed: de ni ma yin no // gsol pa; 'o na ci lags /
translated: “No, it is not.”

original: ma bsgoms pas sam /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pas sam /
translated: He said, “Well then, is it by not cultivating it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / 'o na ci lags /🔽bsgoms kyang bsgoms la /
analyzed: de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / 'o na ci lags / bsgoms kyang bsgoms la /
translated: “No, it is not.”

original: ma bsgoms kyang ma bsgoms pas sam /
analyzed: ma bsgoms kyang ma bsgoms pas sam /
translated: He said, “Well then, is it by cultivating it and also by not cultivating it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / 'o na ci lags /🔽bsgoms pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / 'o na ci lags / bsgoms pa'ang ma lags /
translated: “No, it is not.”

original: ma bsgoms pa'ang ma lags pas sam /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa'ang ma lags pas sam /
translated: He said, “Well then, is it by neither cultivating it nor not cultivating it?”

original: @172a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @172a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: “No, it is not.”🔽He said, “Well then, Blessed One, how is the knowledge of all aspects attained?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects is attained by not cultivating it and not not cultivating it.”

original: 'o na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar thob par bgyi; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar thob par bgyi; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, how does one attain omniscience?”

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “Just as suchness is.”

original: gsol pa / de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / de bzhin nyid ji lta bu lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “And what is suchness like?”

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “Just as the limit of reality is.”

original: gsol pa / yang dag pa'i mtha' ji lta bu lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / yang dag pa'i mtha' ji lta bu lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “And what is the limit of reality like?”

original: chos kyi dbyings ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “Just as the realm of phenomena is.”

original: gsol pa / chos kyi dbyings ji lta bu lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / chos kyi dbyings ji lta bu lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “And what is the realm of phenomena like?”

original: bdag gi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / srog gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / srog gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “Just as the realm of self, the realm of sentient beings, the realm of life, and the realm of person are.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdag gi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / srog gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: bdag gi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / srog gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams ji lta bu lags /
translated: what are the realm of self, the realm of sentient beings, the realm of life, and the realm of person like?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /🔽bdag gam / sems can nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems / bdag gam / sems can nam /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: srog gam / gang zag dmigs su yod dam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: srog gam / gang zag dmigs su yod dam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Is a self, or a being, or a life-force, or a person to be apprehended?”🔽He replied,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, it is not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / bdag gam /🔽sems can nam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / bdag gam / sems can nam /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: srog gam / gang zag mi dmigs na /
analyzed: srog gam / gang zag mi dmigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, if a self, or a being, or a life-force, or a person is not apprehended,

original: ji ltar bdag gi khams dang / sems @172b can gyi khams dang / srog gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams su gdags par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi khams dang / sems @172b can gyi khams dang / srog gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams su gdags par bya /
translated: how can the realm of a self, the realm of a being, the realm of a life-force, or the realm of a person be designated?

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ma btags pa dang / chos thams cad du ma btags pas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ma btags pa dang / chos thams cad du ma btags pas /
translated: In that way, since the perfection of wisdom is not designated and all phenomena are not designated,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects is attained.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked,

original: ci lags / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: ci lags / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: “Blessed One, is the perfection of wisdom not to be designated?”

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gdags sum mchis pa lags sam; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gdags sum mchis pa lags sam; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du gdags su ma mchis pa lags sam /
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects, is it not that it cannot be apprehended?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdags su med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdags su med pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom cannot be apprehended.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdags su med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gdags su med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving cannot be apprehended.

original: nang stong pa nyid ni gdags su med pa'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni gdags su med pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena cannot be apprehended.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni gdags su med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni gdags su med pa'o //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is not something to be appropriated.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni gdags su med pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni gdags su med pa'o //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are not something to be appropriated.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni gdags su med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni gdags su med pa'o //
translated: The right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are not something to be appropriated.

original: @173a *// sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni gdags su med pa'o //
analyzed: @173a *// sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni gdags su med pa'o //
translated: Up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not something to be appropriated.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ni gdags su med pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ni gdags su med pa'o //
translated: Up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is not something to be appropriated.

original: 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas sam /
translated: conditioned or

original: 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: unconditioned,

original: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
translated: the dharmas of śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
translated: the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam /
translated: the dharmas of bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang rung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang rung ste /
translated: or the dharmas of buddhas,

original: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: all dharmas are nondual.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: gal te de ltar chos thams cad gdags su ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar chos thams cad gdags su ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: If all phenomena are not to be found,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ci'i slad du sems can dmyal ba mchis par gyur /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du sems can dmyal ba mchis par gyur /
translated: why are there hells,

original: byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten mchis par gyur /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten mchis par gyur /
translated: animal realms, and worlds of the Lord of Death?

original: lha dang / mi mchis par gyur /
analyzed: lha dang / mi mchis par gyur /
translated: Why are there gods and humans?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa mchis par gyur /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa mchis par gyur /
translated: Why are there stream enterers?

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa mchis par gyur /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa mchis par gyur /
translated: Why are there once-returners, nonreturners, and arhats?

original: rang sangs rgyas mchis par gyur /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas mchis par gyur /
translated: Why are there solitary buddhas?

original: byang chub sems dpa' mchis par gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mchis par gyur /
translated: Why are there bodhisattvas?

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mchis par gyur /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mchis par gyur /
translated: Why are there genuinely perfect buddhas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sems can du gdags pa dmigs su yod dam /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa dmigs su yod dam /
translated: Is it possible to apprehend a designation of sentient beings?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it is not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / sems can dmigs su med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can dmigs su med na /
translated: “Subhūti, if sentient beings are not to be apprehended,

original: sems @173b can dmyal bar yang ji ltar gdags par bya /🔽byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: sems @173b can dmyal bar yang ji ltar gdags par bya / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: How could one designate a sentient being as a hell being?🔽How could one designate a sentient being as an animal?

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /🔽lha'am / mi'am /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam / lha'am / mi'am /
translated: How could one designate a sentient being as a ghost?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'am /
translated: How could one designate a sentient being as a god?🔽How could one designate a sentient being as a human?🔽How could one designate a sentient being as a stream enterer?

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'am /
translated: How could one designate a sentient being as a once-returner?

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'am /🔽dgra bcom pa'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'am / dgra bcom pa'am /
translated: How could one designate a sentient being as a non-returner?🔽How could one designate a sentient being as a worthy one?

original: rang sangs rgyas su'ang ji ltar gdags par bya /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su'ang ji ltar gdags par bya /
translated: How could one designate a sentient being as a pratyekabuddha?

original: byang chub sems dpa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'am /
translated: How could one designate a sentient being as a bodhisattva?

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su'ang ji ltar gdags par bya /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su'ang ji ltar gdags par bya /
translated: How could one designate a sentient being as a perfect buddha?

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: gdags su med pa'i chos thams cad la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gdags su med pa'i chos thams cad la bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in all dharmas that cannot be designated.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs la bslab pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la bslab pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bslab pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: gzugs la bslab pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la bslab pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bslab pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /
translated: It is to train in form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness. It is to train in the sense sources, the elements, and dependent origination. It is to train in all the perfections,🔽all the emptinesses,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad la bslab pa dang; byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bslab pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang; rnam par thar ba dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad la bslab pa dang; byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bslab pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang; rnam par thar ba dang /
translated: the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge @174a *//
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge @174a *//
translated: the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the higher cognitions,🔽and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la bslab pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la bslab pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bslab par bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo la bslab pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la bslab pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bslab par bgyi'am /
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽gzugs la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o; ;tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / gzugs la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o; ;tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “You should train without diminishing or increasing form,🔽and you should train without diminishing or increasing feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.🔽You should train without diminishing or increasing the sense realms,

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: the constituents, or dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: “You should train without diminishing or increasing any of the perfections, any of the emptinesses, or the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: “You should train without diminishing or increasing the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, emptiness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la dbri ba dang bsnan @174b pa med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la dbri ba dang bsnan @174b pa med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: “You should train without diminishing or increasing the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dbri ba dang bsnan pa med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train without subtracting or adding anything up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar gzugs la dbri ba dang bsnan pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la dbri ba dang bsnan pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi /
translated: how should one train without subtracting or adding anything to form?

original: ji ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la dbri ba dang bsnan pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la dbri ba dang bsnan pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should one train without subtracting or adding anything to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness?

original: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dbri ba dang bsnan pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dbri ba dang bsnan pa ma mchis par bslab par bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: How should one train without subtracting or adding anything up to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gags pa med par bslab par bya'o; ;gsol pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gags pa med par bslab par bya'o; ;gsol pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “One should train without producing or stopping anything.

original: bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: ” Subhūti said, “Blessed One, how should one train without producing or stopping anything?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, one should train without producing or stopping form.

original: 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du bya ba med par bsgom pa'am rnam par bsgom pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du bya ba med par bsgom pa'am rnam par bsgom pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in the meditation or contemplation of the non-performance of volitions.🔽Śāriputra said:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: how should one train in the non-performance of volitions?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mthong bas /
analyzed: chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mthong bas /
translated: Seeing that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: one should train in the non-performance of volitions.🔽Śāriputra said:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
analyzed: chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
translated: how should one see that all phenomena are empty of their own marks?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gzugs gzugs kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: gzugs gzugs kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: One should see that form is empty of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / @175a *//
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / @175a *//
translated: One should see that feeling, perception, volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong par blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong par blta'o //
translated: and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas stong par blta'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas stong par blta'o //
translated: the sense realms, the components of perception, and the links of interdependent origination should be seen as empty of the links of interdependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun /
translated: All the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: should be seen as empty of the aspects of enlightenment.

original: 'phags ba'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang; stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags ba'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang; stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: and the doors of concentration, dhāraṇī, and dhāraṇī gateways should be seen as empty of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: should be seen as empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du byang chub kyis stong par blta'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du byang chub kyis stong par blta'o //
translated: up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should be seen as empty of awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in all dharmas empty of their own marks.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: gal te de ltar gzugs @175b ni gzugs kyis stong /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gzugs @175b ni gzugs kyis stong /
translated: if form is empty of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is empty of consciousness,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyis stong na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyis stong na /
translated: up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is empty of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par 'gyur /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / spyod pa med pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / spyod pa med pa ni /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: not practicing is the bodhisattva great beings’ practice of the perfection of wisdom.”🔽He asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du spyod pa ma mchis pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du spyod pa ma mchis pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags /
translated: why is not practicing the practice of the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
translated: the bodhisattva is not apprehended,

original: spyod pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: spyod pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: and practice is not apprehended.

original: gang spyod pa dang / gang gis spyod pa dang / gang la spyod pa de'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gang spyod pa dang / gang gis spyod pa dang / gang la spyod pa de'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: He does not apprehend the one who practices, that by which he practices, or that in which he practices.

original: rab 'byor / gang la spyod pa de dag thams cad mi dmigs pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la spyod pa de dag thams cad mi dmigs pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, when he does not apprehend any of those who practice,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa med pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa med pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: that is the bodhisattva great beings’ practice of the perfection of wisdom, which is not a practice.🔽Subhūti then asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar spyod pa ma mchis pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar spyod pa ma mchis pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags na /
translated: if practicing like that is practicing the perfection of wisdom,
