original: las dang bo pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: las dang bo pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
translated: how should a beginner bodhisattva great being practice the perfection of wisdom?”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom @176a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @176a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nyid nas brtsam te; chos thams cad dmigs su med pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nyid nas brtsam te; chos thams cad dmigs su med pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the bodhisattva great beings who are beginners should, beginning with the very first production of the thought of awakening, train in the nonapprehension of all dharmas.

original: des sbyin pa gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: des sbyin pa gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: When they give a gift,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa gtang bar bya'o //
translated: they should give the gift in a way that is nonapprehensible.

original: tshul khrims srung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung ba'i tshe /
translated: When they guard morality,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: they should guard morality in a way that is nonapprehensible.

original: bzod pa sgrub pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bzod pa sgrub pa'i tshe /
translated: When they cultivate patience,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: they should cultivate patience in a way that is nonapprehensible.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe /
translated: When they make an effort,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o //
translated: they should make an effort in a way that is nonapprehensible.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: When they become absorbed in concentration,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: they should become absorbed in concentration in a way that is nonapprehensible.

original: shes rab sgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab sgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When they cultivate wisdom,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate wisdom in a manner of non-apprehension.

original: nang stong pa nyid sgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid sgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When cultivating the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate the emptiness of internal phenomena in a manner of non-apprehension.🔽When cultivating the emptiness of external phenomena,🔽the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du sgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du sgom pa'i tshe /
translated: the emptiness of emptiness,🔽the emptiness of great extent,🔽the emptiness of ultimate reality,🔽the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,🔽the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena,🔽the emptiness of the unlimited,🔽the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,🔽the emptiness of non-dispersal,🔽the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽the emptiness of all things,🔽the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: the emptiness of non-apprehension,🔽the emptiness of essential nature,🔽and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-apprehension,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate the emptiness of the essential nature of non-apprehension in a manner of non-apprehension.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sgom pa'i tshe /🔽mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sgom pa'i tshe / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: When cultivating the applications of mindfulness,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate the applications of mindfulness in a manner of non-apprehension.🔽When cultivating the right efforts,🔽the legs of miraculous power,🔽the faculties,🔽the powers,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub @176b kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom pa'i tshe /🔽mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub @176b kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom pa'i tshe / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: the branches of enlightenment,🔽and the noble eightfold path,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate the noble eightfold path in a manner of non-apprehension.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,🔽wishlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgom pa'i tshe /
translated: the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: they should practice the dhāraṇī gateways by way of not apprehending anything.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnam bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnam bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When they are practicing the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: they should practice the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du sgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du sgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When they are practicing the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the knowledge of all modes by way of nonapprehension.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord:

original: ji tsam gyis na dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: What is it to apprehend?

original: ji tsam gyis na mi dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na mi dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: What is it not to apprehend?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam du dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam du dmigs pa ste /
translated: The Lord: As long as there is duality, there is apprehension;

original: gnyis su med pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: but when there is no duality, there is no apprehension.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gnyis zhes bgyi ba ji lta bu lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das @177a *//🔽kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gnyis zhes bgyi ba ji lta bu lags / bcom ldan 'das @177a *// kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord: What is duality?

original: ji tsam du mig dang / gzugs nas /
analyzed: ji tsam du mig dang / gzugs nas /
translated: The Lord: As long as there is eye and form,

original: ji tsam du yid dang / chos kyi bar dang / ji tsam du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi bar te /
analyzed: ji tsam du yid dang / chos kyi bar dang / ji tsam du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi bar te /
translated: as long as there is mind and dharmas, as long as there is the knowledge of all modes and a Buddha,

original: rab 'byor / 'di dag ni gnyis so //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags /🔽dmigs su mchis pa mi dmigs sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di dag ni gnyis so // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags / dmigs su mchis pa mi dmigs sam /
translated: this is duality.

original: 'on tam dmigs su ma mchis pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'on tam dmigs su ma mchis pa mi dmigs /
translated: The Lord: Is it the apprehensible that is not apprehended, or is it the inapprehensible that is not apprehended?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / dmigs su yod pa mi dmigs pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dmigs su yod pa mi dmigs pa'ang ma yin /
translated: “Subhūti, it is not that what is observable is not observable,

original: dmigs su med pa mi dmigs pa'ang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa mi dmigs pa'ang ma yin gyi /
translated: nor is it that what is not observable is not observable.

original: rab 'byor / dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, the equality of what is observable and what is not observable is not observable.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid la bslab par bya'o /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid la bslab par bya'o /
translated: Subhūti, this is how bodhisattva great beings should train in the equality of what is observable and what is not observable.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mi dmigs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mi dmigs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who train in the perfection of wisdom in this way will possess nonobservation.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽dmigs pa la'ang mi chags /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / dmigs pa la'ang mi chags /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽are not attached to what is observable

original: mi dmigs pa la'ang mi chags pa lags na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la'ang mi chags pa lags na /
translated: and are not attached to what is not observable,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi /
analyzed: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi /
translated: complete the levels?

original: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs @177b nas ni /
analyzed: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs @177b nas ni /
translated: Having completed the levels,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar thob par bgyi /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar thob par bgyi /
translated: how do they attain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni dmigs pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni dmigs pa la gnas shing /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par mi byed do /
analyzed: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par mi byed do /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not complete the levels while dwelling on a reference point.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽dmigs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / dmigs pa la gnas te /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: cannot complete the levels while dwelling on a reference point.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang dmigs su med /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang dmigs su med /
translated: Why is that?🔽The perfection of wisdom is not apprehended,

original: byang chub kyang dmigs su med de /
analyzed: byang chub kyang dmigs su med de /
translated: and awakening is not apprehended.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'ang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de'ang dmigs su med do //
translated: And that one who practices the perfection of wisdom is also not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like that.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs su ma mchis te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs su ma mchis te /
translated: if the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended like that,

original: gang byang chub tu spyod pa de'ang dmigs su ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gang byang chub tu spyod pa de'ang dmigs su ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: and that one who practices for awakening is also not apprehended,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: then how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom know ‘this is form,’

original: 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: ‘this is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,’

original: 'di ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‘this is the constituents,’ ‘this is the sense fields,’ ‘this is dependent origination,’

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: ‘this is a perfection,’

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: ‘this is emptiness,’

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs @178a *//🔽kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs @178a *// kyi chos so //
translated: This is the factors of awakening.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: This is the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions.

original: 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: This is the liberations and the serial absorptions.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
translated: This is emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: 'di ni mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
translated: This is the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: 'di ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do //
translated: This is the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ro zhes bgyi bar chos thams cad rab tu rtogs par bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ro zhes bgyi bar chos thams cad rab tu rtogs par bgyi /
translated: This is up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: ji ltar byas pas gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dmigs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang; rnam par shes pa dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dmigs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: they do not apprehend form, and they do not apprehend feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness; they do not apprehend the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination;

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med @178b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med @178b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: they do not apprehend the perfections, the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dmigs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dmigs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: the gateways of mnemonic incantation and meditative absorption,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du dmigs par 'gyur ba de ltar chos rnams rtogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du dmigs par 'gyur ba de ltar chos rnams rtogs par mi byed do //
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to and including unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: gzugs kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzugs kyang mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: He does not apprehend feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: He does not apprehend . . . up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'o na ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing /
translated: “Well then, how is the perfection of giving completed, how is the perfection of morality completed, how is the perfection of patience completed, how is the perfection of perseverance completed, how is the perfection of concentration completed, and how is the perfection of wisdom completed,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par 'gyur /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis @179a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par 'gyur / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis @179a *//
translated: and how does one enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva?

original: par chud nas /🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong par 'gyur /
analyzed: par chud nas / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong par 'gyur /
translated: Having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva,🔽how does one purify a buddhafield?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyis nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyis nas /
translated: Having purified a buddhafield,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bgyid par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bgyid par 'gyur /
translated: will bring beings to maturity,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bgyis nas /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bgyis nas /
translated: and having brought beings to maturity,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bgyid par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bgyid par 'gyur /
translated: will attain the knowledge of all modes,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur /
translated: and having attained the knowledge of all modes will set rolling the wheel of the Dharma,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
translated: and having set rolling the wheel of the Dharma

original: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las bsgrub par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las bsgrub par 'gyur /
translated: will accomplish the deeds of a Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las bsgrubs shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las bsgrubs shing /
translated: and having accomplished the deeds of a Buddha

original: sems can rnams 'khor ba nas yongs su 'grel par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor ba nas yongs su 'grel par 'gyur /
translated: will liberate beings from Samsara.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not course in the perfection of wisdom for the sake of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: or for the sake of feeling, perception, the impulses, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: He does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar @179b gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar @179b gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: He does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of all the perfections, all the emptinesses, or the factors of awakening.🔽He does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: or wishlessness; for the sake of the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: For the sake of the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they do not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: For the sake of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they do not practice the perfection of wisdom.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags /
translated: why do bodhisattva great beings not practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: gang gi phyir yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: “Because bodhisattva great beings do not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni ma byas pa ste /
translated: Because all dharmas are unproduced,

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: uncreated, and unmanifested.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma byas pa ste /🔽mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //🔽byang chub kyang ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma byas pa ste / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o // byang chub kyang ma byas pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is also uncreated and unconditioned.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' yang ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' yang ma byas pa ste /
translated: Awakening is also uncreated and unconditioned.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //🔽rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ma byas pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i tshul gyis @180a *//
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o // rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ma byas pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i tshul gyis @180a *//
translated: A bodhisattva is also uncreated and unconditioned.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom in this way, by way of the uncreated and unconditioned.🔽Subhūti then asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te de ltar chos thams cad ma bgyis pa ste /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / gal te de ltar chos thams cad ma bgyis pa ste /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags na /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are uncreated and unconditioned,🔽how is it that the three vehicles—the Hearers’ Vehicle, the Solitary Buddhas’ Vehicle, and the Great Vehicle—are set forth?”

original: 'o na ji ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po dang / theg pa gsum po 'di dag rnam par dgod par 'gyur; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po dang / theg pa gsum po 'di dag rnam par dgod par 'gyur; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / ma byas /🔽mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod pa gang yang dmigs su med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ma byas / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod pa gang yang dmigs su med de /
translated: Subhūti, in uncreated,🔽unconditioned dharmas, no establishment can be apprehended at all.

original: mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod par mi dmigs so //
translated: In conditioned and unconditioned dharmas, no establishment can be apprehended.🔽And why?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa /
translated: It is because foolish, untrained,🔽ordinary people are attached to the five aggregates,🔽attached to form,🔽attached to feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: so so'i skye bo rnams phung po lnga la mngon par zhen cing /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams phung po lnga la mngon par zhen cing /
translated: attached to the sense fields, attached to the elements, attached to dependent origination,🔽attached to the perfections, attached to the emptinesses, attached to the dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽attached to the powers,

original: gzugs la mngon par zhen /
analyzed: gzugs la mngon par zhen /
translated: attached to the fearlessnesses,🔽attached to the detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽attached to the distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen /🔽skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mngon par zhen /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mngon par zhen /
translated: attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la mngon par zhen /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la mngon par zhen /
translated: attached to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽attached to

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar @180b gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar @180b gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the signless,🔽the wishless,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mngon par zhen /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mngon par zhen /
translated: the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mngon par zhen /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mngon par zhen /
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par zhen nas /
translated: up to and the knowledge of all aspects,

original: gzugs kyis rlom sems su byed cing /
analyzed: gzugs kyis rlom sems su byed cing /
translated: they will form mental constructs about form,

original: gzugs su dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs su dmigs so //
translated: and they will apprehend form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pas rlom sems su byed cing /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pas rlom sems su byed cing /
translated: They will form mental constructs about feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: rnam par shes par dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes par dmigs so //
translated: they are fixated on consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas rlom sems su byed cing /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas rlom sems su byed cing /
translated: They are fixated on the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar dmigs so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar dmigs so //
translated: They are fixated on dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyis rlom sems su byed cing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyis rlom sems su byed cing /
translated: They are fixated on the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos su dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos su dmigs so //
translated: They are fixated on the dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: They are fixated on the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgos rlom sems su byed cing /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgos rlom sems su byed cing /
translated: and wishlessness. They are fixated on the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: gzungs kyi sgor dmigs so //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgor dmigs so //
translated: They are fixated on the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: @181a *// stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis rlom sems su byed cing /
analyzed: @181a *// stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis rlom sems su byed cing /
translated: They become conceited because of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres par dmigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres par dmigs so //
translated: They apprehend the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyis rlom sems su byed cing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyis rlom sems su byed cing /
translated: They become conceited because of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du dmigs te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du dmigs te /
translated: They apprehend unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
translated: They think, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: bdag gis sems can rnams 'khor ba nas sgrol bar bya'o snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rnams 'khor ba nas sgrol bar bya'o snyam du sems shing /
translated: They think, ‘I will liberate beings from cyclic existence.’

original: de 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin par rnam par rtog go /
analyzed: de 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin par rnam par rtog go /
translated: They falsely imagine like this.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, it is because form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness; the sense fields; the elements; dependent origination;🔽the perfections;

original: stong pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening; the noble truths; the concentrations; the immeasurables; the formless absorptions; the liberations; the eight deliverances;

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs bcu @181b dang; mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / stobs bcu @181b dang; mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: emptiness; signlessness; wishlessness; the clairvoyances; the meditative stabilizations; the dhāraṇī gateways; the ten powers; the four fearlessnesses; the four detailed and thorough knowledges;

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni /
translated: the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan lngas kyang ma dmigs na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyan lngas kyang ma dmigs na /
translated: The five eyes of the buddhas do not apprehend them.

original: skyes bu glen pa long ba mig med pa de dag ni sems can rnams 'khor ba nas sgrol bar 'dod do //
analyzed: skyes bu glen pa long ba mig med pa de dag ni sems can rnams 'khor ba nas sgrol bar 'dod do //
translated: Those blind, ignorant people want to liberate beings from cyclic existence.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One,

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas kyang /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas kyang /
translated: if the five eyes of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas

original: sems can gang 'khor ba las yongs su sgrol bar bgyi ba de lta bu ma gzigs na /
analyzed: sems can gang 'khor ba las yongs su sgrol bar bgyi ba de lta bu ma gzigs na /
translated: do not see any being to be liberated from cyclic existence,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: then how is it that the Blessed One, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can rnams yang dag par nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa'i phung po gsum du lung bstan pa mdzad /
analyzed: sems can rnams yang dag par nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa'i phung po gsum du lung bstan pa mdzad /
translated: The Blessed One has declared that sentient beings are of three kinds: those who are definitely destined, those who are not definitely destined, and those who are wrongly destined.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / ngas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / ngas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yang dag par nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa'i sems can gang yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: yang dag par nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa'i sems can gang yang mi dmigs te /
translated: Subhūti, I have not found any sentient beings who are definitely destined, who are not definitely destined, or who are wrongly destined, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / 'on kyang sems can dngos po med pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'on kyang sems can dngos po med pa la /
translated: Subhūti, however, sentient beings who do not exist as entities

original: dngos por 'du shes pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa las gdon pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du'o //
analyzed: dngos por 'du shes pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa las gdon pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du'o //
translated: are to be liberated from their apprehension of what is not real, in terms of worldly convention.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa @182a *//
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa @182a *//
translated: But not in terms of the ultimate.

original: la zhugs te /
analyzed: la zhugs te /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, has the Blessed One, having entered the ultimate,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam /
translated: fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / 'o na phyin ci log la zhugs te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / 'o na phyin ci log la zhugs te /
translated: “No, Subhūti.”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhūti said, “Well then, did you attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment by engaging in error?🔽”

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One said, “No, Subhūti.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te de ltar don dam pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / gal te de ltar don dam pa la zhugs te /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'ang ma lags la /🔽phyin ci log la zhugs te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'ang ma lags la / phyin ci log la zhugs te /
translated: if you did not attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment by engaging in the ultimate,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'ang ma lags na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'ang ma lags na /
translated: and you did not attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment by engaging in error,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'am /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gcig tu mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gcig tu mi 'gyur ram /
translated: would you not be a tathāgata who has attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment?🔽”🔽“Subhūti,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: “Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /🔽de'ang 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te / de'ang 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽does not abide in the compounded element

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la'ang gnas te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la'ang gnas te /
translated: or in the uncompounded element,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma yin no //
translated: and has fully awakened to that.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin @182b gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin @182b gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
translated: For example, an emanation of the Tathāgata does not abide in the compounded element

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la'ang gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la'ang gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: or in the uncompounded element,

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de ni 'gro zhing 'ong ba dang gnas shing 'dug pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de ni 'gro zhing 'ong ba dang gnas shing 'dug pa'ang yod do //
translated: but that emanation of the Tathāgata does go and come, and does stand and sit.

original: des gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
analyzed: des gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
translated: If it practices the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad /
translated: the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom;

original: nang stong pa nyid la spyad /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la spyad /
translated: they practiced inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyad /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature;

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la bsgoms /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la bsgoms /
translated: they cultivated the four applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bsgoms /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bsgoms /
translated: the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path;

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la bsgoms /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la bsgoms /
translated: they cultivated the four noble truths;

original: bsam gtan bzhi la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas /
translated: they approached and dwelled in the four concentrations;

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'am  snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'am  snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the meditative stabilization of emptiness, the meditative stabilization of signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas /
translated: and the meditative stabilization of wishlessness.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams mngon par bsgrubs /🔽de bzhin gshegs @183a *//
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams mngon par bsgrubs / de bzhin gshegs @183a *//
translated: He accomplished the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgoms nas /
analyzed: pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgoms nas /
translated: He accomplished the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur la /
translated: He fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, turned the wheel of the Dharma,

original: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
translated: and having turned the wheel of the Dharma,

original: sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa mngon par sprul te /
translated: manifested immeasurable, incalculable sentient beings,

original: phung po gsum du lung bstan na /
analyzed: phung po gsum du lung bstan na /
translated: and having prophesied them to the three vehicles,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sprul pa des sems can gang yang phung por byas pa yod dam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: sprul pa des sems can gang yang phung por byas pa yod dam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Did that emanation make any sentient beings into a vehicle?”

original: de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied, “No, Bhagavān.”

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur mkhyen cing thugs su chud da /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur mkhyen cing thugs su chud da /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Subhūti, similarly, the Tathāgata knows and realizes that all dharmas are like an emanation.

original: sprul pa lta bur mkhyen nas /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bur mkhyen nas /
translated: Having known and realized that they are like an emanation,

original: sems can gang yang dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: sems can gang yang dmigs pa med do //
translated: he does not apprehend any sentient beings at all.

original: btul ba med do //
analyzed: btul ba med do //
translated: He does not tame them.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should thus train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: You should practice the perfection of wisdom like the emanations of the Tathāgata.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are like emanations,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa @183b dang; sprul pa la khyad par dang / bye brag ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa @183b dang; sprul pa la khyad par dang / bye brag ci zhig mchis /
translated: what is the difference between the Tathāgata and an emanation?

original: ci las dgongs pa lags /
analyzed: ci las dgongs pa lags /
translated: What is the intention behind this?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sprul pa la khyad par dang bye brag gang yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sprul pa la khyad par dang bye brag gang yang mi dmigs te /
translated: I do not see any difference or distinction between the Tathāgata and an emanation.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sprul pa la ni khyad par med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sprul pa la ni khyad par med do //
translated: Subhūti, there is no difference between the Tathāgata and an emanation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa phrin las gang mdzad pa'i las de ni sprul pa'ang byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa phrin las gang mdzad pa'i las de ni sprul pa'ang byed do //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the Tathāgata does whatever work he does through an emanation.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs na /
analyzed: ci lags / de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs na /
translated: if the Tathāgata is not present,

original: sprul pa las bgyid par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sprul pa las bgyid par 'gyur ram /
translated: will the work be done by an emanation?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byed do //
translated: “Subhūti, it does.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs na /
translated: if the Tathāgata is not present,

original: ji ltar sprul pa las bgyid par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa las bgyid par 'gyur /
translated: how can there be activity from a magical creation?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhi ba'i blo gros kyis byang chub sems dpa' ma gzigs nas /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhi ba'i blo gros kyis byang chub sems dpa' ma gzigs nas /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha Śāntamati, not seeing any bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sprul te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sprul te /
translated: created a Tathāgata body

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: and then passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: sprul pa des de'i phyi na bskal pa gcig tu sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas te /
analyzed: sprul pa des de'i phyi na bskal pa gcig tu sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas te /
translated: That magical creation performed the activities of a buddha for one eon after that.

original: de'i rjes la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lung bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das par grags kyang /🔽sprul pa la skye ba'am /🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'da' @184a *//
analyzed: de'i rjes la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lung bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das par grags kyang / sprul pa la skye ba'am / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' @184a *//
translated: After that, having given a prophecy to a bodhisattva mahāsattva, it was known to have passed into parinirvāṇa.🔽But that magical creation had no birth

original: ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: ba gang yang med do //
translated: or parinirvāṇa.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di lta ste /🔽chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur yid ches par byas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di lta ste / chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur yid ches par byas shing /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom like this, with the conviction that all phenomena are like magical creations.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽gal te de ltar sprul pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la khyad par ma mchis pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / gal te de ltar sprul pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la khyad par ma mchis pa /
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this, with the conviction that all phenomena are like magical creations, they will not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yon phul na yongs su dag par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yon phul na yongs su dag par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this, with the conviction that all phenomena are like magical creations, they will not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽sems can bsod nams 'tshal ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba don du gnyer ba 'di dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la yon phul na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / sems can bsod nams 'tshal ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba don du gnyer ba 'di dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la yon phul na /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhūti, so it is.🔽Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this, with the conviction that all phenomena are like magical creations, they will not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this, with the conviction that all phenomena are like magical creations, they will not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this, with the conviction that all phenomena are like magical creations, they will not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ni sems can de dag phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par ma gyur gyi bar du nam yang bas bar mi 'gyur na /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de ni sems can de dag phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par ma gyur gyi bar du nam yang bas bar mi 'gyur na /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this, with the conviction that all phenomena are like magical creations, they will not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ci lags / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la yon phul na'ang sems can de dag phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par ma gyur gyi bar du nam yang bas par mi 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: ci lags / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la yon phul na'ang sems can de dag phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par ma gyur gyi bar du nam yang bas par mi 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: “Is it the case that, in the same way, even if offerings are made to a Tathāgata’s emanation, they will never be exhausted until those sentient beings have attained nirvāṇa in the expanse of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left behind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor; chos nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi yon gyi gnas su gyur pa'i chos nyid de nyid kyis /
analyzed: rab 'byor; chos nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi yon gyi gnas su gyur pa'i chos nyid de nyid kyis /
translated: “Subhūti, by the very reality that the Tathāgata is an object of offerings for the world with its gods,

original: sprul pa la'ang lha dang bcas pa'i @184b 'jig rten gyi yon gyi gnas so //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba lta zhog ste /
analyzed: sprul pa la'ang lha dang bcas pa'i @184b 'jig rten gyi yon gyi gnas so // rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba lta zhog ste /
translated: that very reality is also an object of offerings for the world with its gods for the emanation.🔽“Subhūti, set aside the offering of gifts to the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la yon phul ba lta'ang zhog gi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la yon phul ba lta'ang zhog gi /
translated: Set aside also the offering of gifts to the Tathāgata’s emanation.

original: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las byams pa dang ldan par de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las byams pa dang ldan par de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byas na /
translated: Subhūti, if any son or daughter of good family were to bring to mind the Tathāgata with love,

original: de thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i mthar ma phyin par sdug bsngal gyis mthar phyin par 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: de thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i mthar ma phyin par sdug bsngal gyis mthar phyin par 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor /
translated: all of them would not reach the end of suffering without reaching the end of that wholesome action.

original: byams pa dang ldan par yid la byed pa lta zhog gi /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan par yid la byed pa lta zhog gi /
translated: Subhūti, let alone bringing to mind with love,

original: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig /
translated: Subhūti, if any son or daughter of good family

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byas shing nam mkha' la me tog 'thor na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byas shing nam mkha' la me tog 'thor na /
translated: were to scatter flowers in the sky while bringing the Tathāgata to mind,

original: de thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i mthar ma phyin par sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i mthar ma phyin par sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: all of them would not reach the end of suffering without reaching the end of that wholesome action.

original: rab 'byor / byams pa dang ldan par yid la byed pa lta'ang zhog ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byams pa dang ldan par yid la byed pa lta'ang zhog ste /
translated: Subhūti, let alone bringing to mind with love,

original: nam mkha' la me tog 'thor ba lta'ang zhog gi /
analyzed: nam mkha' la me tog 'thor ba lta'ang zhog gi /
translated: let alone scattering flowers in the sky,

original: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes brjod na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes brjod na /
translated: Subhūti, if any son or daughter of good family were to say, “I pay homage to the Buddha,”

original: de dag thams cad kyang rim gyis sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang rim gyis sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: all of them will eventually reach the end of suffering.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar don che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar don che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, such is the great benefit of offering to the Tathāgata,

original: de lta bu'i legs pa chen po dang / de lta bu'i yon tan chen po yod do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i legs pa chen po dang / de lta bu'i yon tan chen po yod do //
translated: such is the great excellence, such is the great quality.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs de ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid btsan par byas na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la bye brag gang yang @185a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs de ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid btsan par byas na / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la bye brag gang yang @185a *//
translated: Subhūti, by this method, having ascertained the intrinsic nature of phenomena,

original: med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: med par rig par bya ste /
translated: one should understand that there is no difference at all between the Tathāgata and the Tathāgata’s emanation.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rnams kyi chos nyid khong du chud par byas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rnams kyi chos nyid khong du chud par byas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, in this way, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, having understood the intrinsic nature of phenomena, should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de'ang rnam par 'khrug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de'ang rnam par 'khrug par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not disturb the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not disturb it by saying, ‘This is the intrinsic nature of the perfection of wisdom.’

original: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not disturb it by saying, ‘This is the intrinsic nature of the perfection of generosity.’

original: 'di ni nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: 'di ni nang stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nang stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not disturb it by saying, ‘This is the intrinsic nature of the emptiness of internal phenomena.’

original: 'di ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ro //
translated: This is up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
translated: This is the reality of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams so //
translated: This is the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
translated: This is the reality of the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'di ni yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'di ni 'phags @185b pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //🔽'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags @185b pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o // 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ro //
translated: This is the reality of the noble eightfold path.🔽This is the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.
