original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
translated: This is the reality of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: This is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid do zhes rnam par dkrug par mi bya'o //
translated: “This is the reality of the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrug par mi bgyis lags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrug par mi bgyis lags na /
translated: if one should not disturb the reality of phenomena,🔽then why did the Thus-Gone One disturb it when he said,

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: ‘This is form,

original: 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byad  dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byad  dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: this is feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness,

original: 'di ni skye mched do //
analyzed: 'di ni skye mched do //
translated: this is the sense sources,

original: 'di ni khams so //
analyzed: 'di ni khams so //
translated: this is the elements,

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: this is dependent origination,

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
translated: this is the perfections,

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid rnams so; ;'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid rnams so; ;'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: this is emptiness, this is the factors of awakening,

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ro //
translated: up to this is the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ro zhes rnam par dkrug pa mdzad na /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ro zhes rnam par dkrug pa mdzad na /
translated: and this is the knowledge of all aspects’?

original: de'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrug par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: de'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrug par ma gyur tam /
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, is the intrinsic nature of phenomena not being disturbed?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, that is not the case.

original: ngas ji ltar na gzhan rnams khong du chud par 'gyur zhes ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te chos rnams brjod kyi /
analyzed: ngas ji ltar na gzhan rnams khong du chud par 'gyur zhes ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te chos rnams brjod kyi /
translated: I teach the intrinsic nature of phenomena with names and marks, saying, ‘How can others understand?’

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrug pa med do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrug pa med do //
translated: I do not disturb the intrinsic nature of phenomena.”

original: gsol @186a *// pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol @186a *// pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One,🔽if the Blessed One teaches the intrinsic nature of phenomena with names and marks

original: gal te gzhan rnams khong du chud par bgyi pa'i slad du /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te /🔽chos rnams brjod pa mdzad na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan rnams khong du chud par bgyi pa'i slad du / bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te / chos rnams brjod pa mdzad na /
translated: in order for others to understand,

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ming ma mchis shing mtshan ma ma mchis pa la ji ltar ming dang mtshan mas brjod pa mdzad /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ming ma mchis shing mtshan ma ma mchis pa la ji ltar ming dang mtshan mas brjod pa mdzad /
translated: Blessed One, since all phenomena are nameless and without marks, how do you teach with names and marks?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / brjod pa ni ming yang ma yin /🔽mtshan ma'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / brjod pa ni ming yang ma yin / mtshan ma'ang ma yin /
translated: Subhuti: A designation is neither a name nor a sign.

original: mngon par chags pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a clinging to a name,🔽or a clinging to a sign.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan du na sdug bsngal nyid brjod par zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan du na sdug bsngal nyid brjod par zad de /
translated: Subhuti: It is only suffering that is designated.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags pa med do //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'am /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ni /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags pa med do // rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'am / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ni /
translated: There is no clinging to a name or a sign.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags par mi 'gyur te /🔽rab 'byor / gal te ming la mngon par chags par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags par mi 'gyur te / rab 'byor / gal te ming la mngon par chags par 'gyur ram /
translated: Subhuti: The Tathagata or the disciples of the Tathagata do not cling to a name or a sign.

original: mtshan ma la mngon par chags par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma la mngon par chags par 'gyur na ni /
translated: Subhuti: If they should cling to a name or a sign,

original: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //🔽mtshan ma med pa'ang mtshan ma med pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro // mtshan ma med pa'ang mtshan ma med pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: then emptiness would cling to emptiness,🔽the Signless to the Signless,

original: smon pa med pa'ang smon pa med pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'ang smon pa med pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: the Wishless to the Wishless.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang de bzhin nyid la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang de bzhin nyid la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Suchness would be attached to suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: The very limit of reality would be attached to the very limit of reality.

original: chos kyi dbyings @186b kyang chos kyi dbyings la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings @186b kyang chos kyi dbyings la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: The dharma-constituent would be attached to the dharma-constituent.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas la mngon par chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas la mngon par chags par 'gyur te /
translated: The uncompounded would be attached to the uncompounded.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad kyang ming tsam du zad pas na de dag ni ming tsam la gnas pa med do //🔽rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming dang mtshan ma la gnas te /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad kyang ming tsam du zad pas na de dag ni ming tsam la gnas pa med do // rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming dang mtshan ma la gnas te /
translated: All these dharmas are just names, and so they do not stand in just names.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should stand in just names and stand in just signs and practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not be attached to them.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: gal te de ltar 'dus byas de dag thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du bas ba lags na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gang gi don du byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'dus byas de dag thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du bas ba lags na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gang gi don du byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
translated: If all these conditioned things are just names and signs, for whose sake do the bodhisattva great beings arouse the mind set on awakening?

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Having aroused the mind set on awakening,

original: 'du byed rnams du ma nyams su myong bar bgyid pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa lags /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams du ma nyams su myong bar bgyid pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa lags /
translated: why do they experience many conditioned things and practice the bodhisattva deeds?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing sbyin pa sna tshogs yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing sbyin pa sna tshogs yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang /
translated: While practicing the bodhisattva deeds, why do they give various gifts, guard morality, cultivate patience, undertake perseverance, enter into concentration, and cultivate wisdom?

original: stong pa nyid thams cad la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang /🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam @187a *//
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang; rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam @187a *//
translated: They practice the emptiness of all phenomena, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening,

original: gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: and the noble eightfold path. They practice the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness.

original: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: and the dhāraṇī gateways, and who practice the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa lags ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa lags //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: bam po drug cu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po drug cu gcig pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: gang de skad du /
analyzed: gang de skad du /
translated: if you think

original: gal te 'dus byas thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad na /
translated: that if all conditioned things are just names and signs,

original: 'o na gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod ces zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod ces zer ba ni /
translated: then for whose sake do bodhisattva great beings practice the bodhisattva practice?”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar 'dus byas thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad de /🔽ming yang ming gis stong /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar 'dus byas thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad de / ming yang ming gis stong /
translated: Subhūti, all conditioned things are just names and signs.🔽Names are empty of names.

original: mtshan ma yang mtshan mas stong bas na /
analyzed: mtshan ma yang mtshan mas stong bas na /
translated: Signs are empty of signs.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practice the bodhisattva practices

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: and attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: @187b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: @187b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects, they turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
translated: Having turned the wheel of the Dharma,

original: sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las zlo ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las zlo ste /
translated: they liberate sentient beings through the three vehicles.

original: ming dang mtshan ma de la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma de la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs so //
translated: In those names and signs, arising, ceasing, staying, and changing from a state of rest are not apprehended.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces gsung ngam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces gsung ngam /
translated: do you say ‘knowledge of all aspects,’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces smra'o; ;gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces smra'o; ;gsol pa /
translated: “Subhūti, I say that the knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad shes pa nyid du gsungs pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces mdor gsungs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad shes pa nyid du gsungs pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces mdor gsungs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs na /
translated: the Tathāgata has spoken of the knowledge of all things, has spoken of the knowledge of the aspects of the path in brief, and has spoken of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa de gsum la khyed ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa de gsum la khyed ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: what is the difference between these three knowledges?

original: bye brag ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: bye brag ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: rnam pa ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: rnam pa ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: What is the aspect?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The Lord said,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the knowledge of all things is to be known as that of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the aspects of the path is to be known as that of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @188a *//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @188a *//
translated: Omniscience is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Completely Enlightened One.🔽

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is to be known as the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened ones.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: ci'i slad du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la ni thams cad shes pa nyid ces bgyi; ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bgyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci'i slad du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la ni thams cad shes pa nyid ces bgyi; ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: why is it called the knowledge of all aspects for the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and why is it called the knowledge of the aspects of the path for bodhisattva great beings?

original: rab 'byor / ji tsam du phyi dang nang gi chos ji snyed pa tsam ni thams cad nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji tsam du phyi dang nang gi chos ji snyed pa tsam ni thams cad nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes te /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas know just as much as there is of outer and inner phenomena,

original: lam thams cad du ni ma yin no //🔽rab 'byor / gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: lam thams cad du ni ma yin no // rab 'byor / gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na /
translated: but not all paths.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bya zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bya zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Subhūti, as for what you have asked—‘Why is it called the knowledge of the aspects of the path for bodhisattva great beings?’—

original: rab 'byor / lam thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: rab 'byor / lam thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsgrub par bya /
translated: Subhūti, all paths are to be practiced by bodhisattva great beings.

original: lam thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lam thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes par bya ste /
translated: All paths are to be known by bodhisattva great beings.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang ji snyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gang ji snyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba yin la /
translated: All the paths of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and all the paths of bodhisattvas are to be perfected.

original: lam de dag gis kyang lam gyi bya ba bya dgos te /
analyzed: lam de dag gis kyang lam gyi bya ba bya dgos te /
translated: And the work of the paths must be done by those paths.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not actualize the very limit of reality.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyi 'tshal na /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyi 'tshal na /
translated: if bodhisattva great beings are to perfect the buddhas’ path,

original: 'o na ni des yang @188b dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon du bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni des yang @188b dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon du bgyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then they will actualize the very limit of reality.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas la /
translated: Subhuti, without purifying the Buddha-field,🔽

original: sems can yongs su smin par ma byas par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par ma byas par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should not realize the very limit of reality without purifying a buddhafield and without developing living beings.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam la gnas te /
analyzed: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam la gnas te /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings stand on the path

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du bgyi'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du bgyi'am /
translated: and realize the very limit of reality?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“No.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: No, they do not.🔽

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: 'o na lam ma lags pa la gnas te'am; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'o na lam ma lags pa la gnas te'am; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Well then, do they stand on a path that is not a path?🔽”🔽The Lord said,🔽“No.

original: ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / 'o na lam yang lags la /
analyzed: ma yin no // gsol pa / 'o na lam yang lags la /
translated: ”🔽Subhūti said,

original: lam ma lags pa la'ang gnas te'am /
analyzed: lam ma lags pa la'ang gnas te'am /
translated: “Well then, do they stand on a path and on a path that is not a path?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“No.

original: ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / 'o na lam yang ma lags la /🔽lam ma lags pa'ang ma lags pa la gnas te'am /
analyzed: ma yin no // gsol pa / 'o na lam yang ma lags la / lam ma lags pa'ang ma lags pa la gnas te'am /
translated: ”🔽Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Well then, do they stand on neither a path nor on a path that is not a path?🔽”

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: “No, it does not.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du bgyi /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du bgyi /
translated: “Well then, Blessed One, how should bodhisattva great beings realize the very limit of reality?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti,

original: khyod lam la gnas pas nye bar len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lam /
analyzed: khyod lam la gnas pas nye bar len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lam /
translated: do you think that by abiding in the path you have liberated your mind from the defilements without grasping?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: that is not the case.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,
“Well then,

original: lam ma yin pa la gnas te'am /
analyzed: lam ma yin pa la gnas te'am /
translated: do you think that by abiding in what is not the path you have liberated your mind from the defilements without grasping?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: that is not the case.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽'o na lam yang yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / 'o na lam yang yin la /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lam ma yin pa la'ang gnas te'am /
analyzed: lam ma yin pa la'ang gnas te'am /
translated: “Well then, do you think that by abiding in both the path and what is not the path you have liberated your mind from the defilements without grasping?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: that is not the case.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽'o na lam yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / 'o na lam yang ma yin la /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lam ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: lam ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa la gnas te /
translated: “Well then, do you think that by abiding in neither the path nor what is not the path you have liberated your mind from the defilements without grasping?”

original: len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lam /
analyzed: len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lam /
translated: “Is the mind liberated from defilements without grasping?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: it is not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi sems ni gang la'ang gnas pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi sems ni gang la'ang gnas pas /
translated: “Blessed One, my mind does not abide anywhere,

original: nye bar len pa ma mchis bar zag pa las sems rnam par grol ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa ma mchis bar zag pa las sems rnam par grol ba ma mchis te /
translated: so it is liberated from defilements without grasping.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis sems ni gang la'ang mi gnas pas rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: bdag gis sems ni gang la'ang mi gnas pas rnam par grol lo //
translated: my mind is liberated because it does not abide anywhere.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ci la'ang mi gnas par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ci la'ang mi gnas par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du bya'o // rab 'byor / gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, bodhisattva great beings should actualize the very limit of reality without abiding anywhere.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Subhūti, that which is called ‘the knowledge of all aspects’

original: rnam pa gcig gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: is called ‘the knowledge of all aspects’ for one reason.

original: 'di ltar zhi ba'i rnam pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi ba'i rnam pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called ‘the knowledge of all aspects’ because it is the aspect of peace.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang / mtshan ma gang gis chos @189b rnams brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang / mtshan ma gang gis chos @189b rnams brjod par bya ba'i rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pas /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the Tathāgata has realized those aspects, those modes, and those signs by which phenomena are to be expressed.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o; ;gsol pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o; ;gsol pa /
translated: Therefore, it is called the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bgyi ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bgyi ba /
translated: Subhūti said:🔽Bhagavān, these three knowledges—the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and the knowledge of all aspects—

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di gsum las nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rnam pa 'dis ni lhag ma ma lus par spangs so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di gsum las nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rnam pa 'dis ni lhag ma ma lus par spangs so //
translated: are they different in terms of the aspects of the abandonment of afflictions?

original: 'dis ni lhag ma ma lus par ma spangs so zhes bgyi ba'i bye brag mchis sam /
analyzed: 'dis ni lhag ma ma lus par ma spangs so zhes bgyi ba'i bye brag mchis sam /
translated: Are they different in terms of the aspects of the abandonment and non-abandonment of the remainder?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: rab 'byor / nyon mongs pa spangs pa la ni bye brag med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nyon mongs pa spangs pa la ni bye brag med de /
translated: Subhūti, there is no difference in the abandonment of afflictions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa mnga'o; ;nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa mnga'o; ;nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la ni /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has abandoned all the connections of habitual tendencies.🔽

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa med do //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa med do //
translated: The Tathāgata has eliminated all the connections of the latent tendencies, but the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / nyan thos dang; rang sangs rgyas de dag thams cad kyis 'dus ma bgyis ma thob par nyon mongs pa spangs sam /
analyzed: ci lags / nyan thos dang; rang sangs rgyas de dag thams cad kyis 'dus ma bgyis ma thob par nyon mongs pa spangs sam /
translated: have all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas eliminated the afflictions without attaining the unconditioned?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: “No, they have not.🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das; ci lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; ci lags /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'dus ma bgyis pa la bye brag dmigs su mchis sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma bgyis pa la bye brag dmigs su mchis sam /
translated: are there distinctions to be found in the unconditioned?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: “No, there are not.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te de @190a *//
analyzed: gal te de @190a *//
translated: if that is so,

original: ltar dmigs su ma mchis na /🔽ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad du 'di la ni /
analyzed: ltar dmigs su ma mchis na / ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad du 'di la ni /
translated: and there are no distinctions to be found,

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa mnga'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa mnga'o //
translated: why did the Blessed One say that the Tathāgata has eliminated the connections of the latent tendencies,🔽but the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have not?

original: 'di la ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa spangs pa med do zhes bka' stsal /
analyzed: 'di la ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa spangs pa med do zhes bka' stsal /
translated: Here, there is no abandonment of the connection of habitual tendencies.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba ni nyon mongs pa'ang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba ni nyon mongs pa'ang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, the connection of habitual tendencies is not an affliction.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi lus kyi rnam pa dang / ngag gi rnam pa yod de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi lus kyi rnam pa dang / ngag gi rnam pa yod de /
translated: However, śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have the form of attachment, anger, and delusion in their bodies and speech.

original: de dag gi bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa de ni byis pa so so'i skye bo kun dang thun mong du gnod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa de ni byis pa so so'i skye bo kun dang thun mong du gnod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: That connection of their habitual tendencies is not shared in common with all foolish ordinary beings.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la; thams cad du thams cad /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la; thams cad du thams cad /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One does not have any of that at all,

original: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mi mnga' zhing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mi mnga' zhing mi dmigs so //
translated: in any way, anywhere. He does not have it, and he does not observe it.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One does not have any of that at all, in any way, anywhere. He does not have it, and he does not observe it.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te lam yang ma mchis la /
analyzed: gal te lam yang ma mchis la /
translated: if there are no paths

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma mchis na /🔽'o na ci'i slad du /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma mchis na / 'o na ci'i slad du /
translated: and no nirvāṇa,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: then why do you say

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: that this is a stream enterer,

original: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: this is a once-returner,

original: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: this is a non-returner,

original: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: this is a worthy one,

original: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: this is a pratyekabuddha,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: this is a bodhisattva great being,

original: @190b 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bshad /
analyzed: @190b 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bshad /
translated: and this is a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de dag thams cad kyang 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de dag thams cad kyang 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: Subhuti: Are all these distinctions, i.e. Streamwinner, etc. to: Tathagata, made on the unconditioned side?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci lags / 'dus ma bgyis te /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ci lags / 'dus ma bgyis te /
translated: The Lord: Yes.

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //🔽'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o // 'di ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: Subhuti: Is there a distinction between the unconditioned and the conditioned?

original: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: The Lord: No, Subhuti.🔽Subhuti: Is there a distinction between the unconditioned and the unconditioned?

original: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The Lord: No, Subhuti.🔽Subhuti: Is there a distinction between the conditioned and the conditioned?

original: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so //🔽'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas so // 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: The Lord: No, Subhuti.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bgyi bar rab tu 'byed pa mchis sam /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bgyi bar rab tu 'byed pa mchis sam /
translated: Subhuti: If there is no distinction between the conditioned and the unconditioned, or between the unconditioned and the conditioned, how then can the distinction be made that 'this is the conditioned, that is the unconditioned'?🔽The Lord: The Tathagata has proclaimed the distinction between the conditioned and the unconditioned, but in reality there is no distinction between the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / 'dus ma byas ni rab tu 'byed pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'dus ma byas ni rab tu 'byed pa med mod kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, unconditioned phenomena are not differentiated,

original: 'on kyang tshig tshad mar byas shing brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshig tshad mar byas shing brjod de /
translated: but they are expressed by means of a valid term.

original: don dam par ni rab tu dbye bar mi nus so //
analyzed: don dam par ni rab tu dbye bar mi nus so //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, they cannot be differentiated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de la tshig gi lam gyi gdags pa med de /
analyzed: de la tshig gi lam gyi gdags pa med de /
translated: Because there is no designation of a path of words there.

original: 'on kyang gang dang gang gis mtha' ma chod pa de dang de dag la phyi ma'i mthar gdags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang dang gang gis mtha' ma chod pa de dang de dag la phyi ma'i mthar gdags pa yin te /
translated: But whatever is limited by the end is designated as the end.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la /
translated: Subhūti, if all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: sngon gyi mtha' yas mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' yas mi dmigs na /
translated: the prior limit is not apprehended.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' @191a *//
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' @191a *//
translated: How could the later limit

original: dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de gnas med do //
analyzed: dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de gnas med do //
translated: be apprehended? It is impossible.

original: rab 'byor / sems can de dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can de dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pas /
translated: Subhūti, since sentient beings do not know that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: de dag la 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad du /
translated: they are taught as follows:

original: 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: ‘This is the prior limit.

original: 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya'o zhes bstan te /
translated: This is called the future.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la sngon gyi mtha' 'am /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la sngon gyi mtha' 'am /
translated: In all phenomena that are empty of their own marks,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' dmigs su med do //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' dmigs su med do //
translated: the prior limit or the later limit is not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
translated: and you should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la spyad na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la spyad na /
translated: When you practice all phenomena that are empty of their own marks,

original: nang ngam / phyi'i chos sam /🔽'dus byas sam /
analyzed: nang ngam / phyi'i chos sam / 'dus byas sam /
translated: you will not become attached to any inner or outer phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: conditioned phenomena or unconditioned phenomena,

original: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos sam /
translated: Śrāvaka phenomena,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
translated: Pratyekabuddha phenomena,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or Buddha phenomena.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Subhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa thob pa yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is the attainment of the highest perfection of all dharmas.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang @191b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang @191b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, by this perfection of wisdom, all śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened ones,

original: chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par gyur /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par gyur /
translated: have reached the perfection of all dharmas,

original: pha rol tu phyin /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin /
translated: have reached the other shore,

original: pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur bas /
translated: and will reach the other shore.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of wisdom.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad kyi mchog gi tshul phyed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mchog gi tshul phyed de /
translated: divides the supreme mode of all dharmas.

original: chos de dag kun la'ang 'khor ba ma dmigs pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: chos de dag kun la'ang 'khor ba ma dmigs pas de'i phyir /
translated: And since even those dharmas are not observed in saṃsāra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, in this perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin nyid kyang chud /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang chud /
translated: suchness is included,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang chud /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang chud /
translated: the limit of reality is included,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang chud de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang chud de /
translated: and the dharma-constituent is included.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang gis kyang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o // rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang gis kyang ldan pa'am /
translated: Therefore it is called the perfection of wisdom.🔽Moreover, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is not associated with or

original: mi ldan pa'am /🔽bstan du yod pa'am /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'am / bstan du yod pa'am /
translated: disassociated from any dharma,

original: bstan du med pa'am /
analyzed: bstan du med pa'am /
translated: is not demonstrable or not demonstrable,

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: is not impeded or

original: thogs pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: not impeded.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Because this perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: Formless.
